column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Absolutely luv the fit. But so disappointed by the front panel which is super shiny. My guess is it is made of luxtreme instead of full-lux in this area. Had they specified I never would have purchased them! Wondering if crops r the same up front???? Ugh shiny blows! Unless that's what ur in to. Anyway great pant if u don't mind the shine. Just know to expect it!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Really liked the feel and fit of these pants. Makes your butt look GREAT! I'm 5'4/5'5ish so it's just too much material in the legs. You can always get them hemmed at a Lululemon store, but I returned them instead haha. Overall great pant but not 100% for me.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: While these seem to well constructed with quality fabric, they're not high rise (at all) on my 5'3" frame and come to just below my belly button. I do have a longer torso than most women of my height, but this is the first I've experienced issues with high rise pants falling short. They're also much too long and while I realize they're listed as a 28" length, I wasn't expecting them to pool around the ankle as badly as they do. While these might be the perfect fit for some, they, unfortunately, hit me in all the wrong places (sad face).

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
A friend of mine swears by these....I trusted her enough to buy two pair of these tights. After a couple of wearings, the back of the knees started bagging and like other reviews, the waistband stretched out....I have to constantly pull them up which probably adds to the stretching out.
I do like the seaming, very flattering but so frustrating to have sprung for two pair and now not enjoying wearing them; in fact, I do not wear them.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Literally, these pants changed my life. I used to wear running shorts to the gym and always felt frumpy in my gym clothes. I wasn't confident enough to wear tight leggings until I found the All the Right Places Pant. They're so flattering and comfortable, I felt incredible in them and in turn, began working out more and pushing harder because I liked what I was seeing in the mirror. I've lost and kept off over 35 pounds in the past 3 years and I don't go a day without wearing these pants! I have almost every color available. I've always been thicker on the bottom so for any girls who can relate, these are the pants for you. I can't say enough good things about them. They look amazing on, have pockets for your gear, and hold up well in the wash. Please don't ever stop making these Lululemon!
column15: not enough colors available in pant

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Got 2 pairs of these leggings 2 months ago and LOVED them at first - they were my go to! But the waistband on both pairs quickly stretched out and I can't do most of my workouts in them... just casual yoga and pilates. Can't keep them pulled up enough for my fast paced HIIT workouts. Still very flattering and get compliments on them but ultimately not functional. Disappointed. Will stick with my fast and free leggings that have a drawstring and pocket.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: "this has been the worst trade deal in the history of trade deals, maybe ever"
column6: This was my first pair of all the right places pants and I was so excited to try them....that was until I actually worked out in them. I constantly have to keep pulling them up in between my workouts. The waistband has stretched so much and there are some loose threads on some of the stitching already. I should mention that I've only washed these pants TWICE. I really do love the fabric and the feel of it but definitely not worth $128, very disappointed. If you're planning on buying definitely size down one or two sizes!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was so nervous but excited to buy my first pair of Lululemon pants. I have always had an eye for the brand but I never actually purchased any of their products until this last December. I always thought they were super cute and flattering, but EXTREMELY expensive for my college student budget. Well, I saved up my money and went out and bought my first pair of All the Right Places Pant. I liked what the lady at the store had to say about them, and I especially loved the idea of the pant design that made a camel-toe avoidable. After the first couple of weeks I noticed that the pants had stretched out, but I was told by the lady at the store they hold their stretchiness. I got over the fact that they weren't as stretchy anymore, but then I began noticing how easy it was to snag the pants on anything no matter how hard I tried keeping care of them. Since I spent so much on them I wanted to make sure they looked like new every time I wore them. After trying to get over the pulls, I noticed the other day that now my pants have a hole in the pocket where my id card fits, I only noticed because the card is white. The hole isn't on the seam, it is just in the fabric. Not even four months with these pants and I will never spend that much money ever again on this brand.

Was expecting much more for $130 pants.

column6: The pants are labeled to be one of the tightest Lululemon makes, however, this is NOT anywhere close to the truth. Maybe wore the pants 3 times and I started second guessing myself if I bought a bigger size than I intended to [correct size]. The pants became so loose, after NOT even working out in them, so quickly too no less. Not only did the pants become loose around the leg area, waistband, etc, the pants also became loose around the ankles? I am not even sure how. For $140 pants, I at least expected them to fit snugly. I'm disappointed in the quality of these pants so much so it made me consider switching to Alo Yoga for my yoga gear. I hope to see Lululemon improve their pant quality fit so I can remain a loyal customer.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Black fabric appears to be different fabric than color fabric
column6: There are two things that aren't great about this pant: 1) the fabric stretches out (I sized down a size in the cropped version, and it still bunches around my knees - I ordered this one two sizes down, but the straight seams aren't straight, which I think means that it's too tight), and 2) the black full length isn't as silky as the purple crop one I bought. I think the fabric is different. Despite stretching out a little, I love the purple crop because the fabric was this cool mix of being thin, silky, and structured, but the black fabric isn't as soft. There is also a cool contrast in the purple so that there is a subtle two tone look, and if it exists with the black, it is not visible to me. So I think I will try to order it in navy and see if the black is an outlier.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Flattering Design, but the fit is too loose
column6: I was really excited to get these pants, they feel amazing, the material is smooth and cooling and all the seams are extremely flattering to your shape, they really do accentuate you in 'all the right places'. Unfortunately I can only wear them for errands as I found out after 1 run they are terrible for running. They constantly slid down my waist and I had to keep stopping to pull them up. Was really annoying and I will never wear them to run in, which is the main purpose I wanted to get them for. A bit too expensive to have as just lounging pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey AngelStar,\nThank you for taking the time to connect with us. Nobody likes when their pants stretch out, and making things right for you is our priority. Keep an eye on your inbox—I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 27, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: i feel so bad i got 2 of them but in 23" while I'm super tall whyyyyy you didn't get them earlier :(
column14: so tight just in love for fitness
column15: nothing they are perfect as i said wish i got them

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"

Feels like I could have sized down a whole size or 2. They were super flattering but now I am just pulling them up most of the time I wear them. Wish I had read reviews first!

column5: wish i listened to the reviews

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: When I first bought these leggings, I absolutely loved them, they were so flattering and comfortable! Not too long after, a hole developed in the back of the leggings, by my upper thigh, and the seams started to come apart by the waistband. Needless to say I was disappointed. I took advantage of lululemon's Quality Promise, and I got a free repair! The employees at the store were so helpful and I had my repaired leggings shipped to my house for free. It has been a couple months since then, and yet another hole has developed on the side. The quality of these leggings is mediocre, and especially after paying over $130 for them, I am extremely disappointed.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Great fitting pair of pants BUT SHABBY hemming job, loose threads
column6:
I've loved the all the right places crop since the day I bought them a year ago, finding them to be the perfect compression leggings I used at the gym for almost all kinds of workouts, including running, weights, stretches and sometimes even yoga. Super versatile and snug, sucking all the right parts in, really.
However my biggest issue with the pants has been the loose threads on the edges and at the base of the pants, with the threads coming apart at the seams because of a poor hemming job. This has been super distracting when I'm deadlifting or running, and look down to see threads loose at my ankles and inner thighs.
In fact, it's been my second pair of pants (the first pair had the same problem and had to be replaced). Unfortunately, I'm not sure if I'll purchase another pair because the threads keep coming loose and I do not want to have to go to the store to get another hemming job done.
column15: loose threads along the side of legs distracting

It\'ll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.', 'LL_response_date': 'March 25, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I have had these for about a year. Washed in cold and hang to dry. Now I have to pull them up all the time. Can't really do much cardio in these. Going a smaller size maybe?

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
After buying these tights, initially I was in love. After a couple wears though, I noticed a small hole in the seam. I took them in to be fixed, and the lululemon seamstress did not do the best job. After another wear, the hole quickly appeared and after taking a closer look the job seemed kind of sloppy. Seams in other areas are starting to come apart as well.
I received these same tights as a gift, and instead of returning them, decided to give them another chance since the other pair were failing. My new pair, so far have kept up MUCH better than my first pair. But still don't seem to live up to the $118 price and I do not wear them often afraid that they will not last which is disappointing because I would love to workout out in them and do everyday activity without having this worry.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi jayjay27,\n\nThis definitely doesn't sound right. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 15, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: i wish i read the reviews first...
column6: i SO wish i read the reviews before purchasing these. What others are saying is correct - they fit amazing at first, but start stretching out after a couple workouts. they are now loose in the ankle and waist for me, and i constantly have to pull them up while lifting. definitely would not be able to do any sort of cardio or squat workout in these now. disappointed i wasted the money :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey LauMau,\n\nThanks for reaching out and providing this feedback to us. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and we’d like to work with you towards a fix. I’ve sent you an email to follow up and help further.', 'LL_response_date': 'March 15, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: First time I'd ever purchased from lulu, first pair the front stitching came loose and they replaced without a problem except I live 90 miles from the closest store so the drive was inconvenient. Second pair fit like a dream, wore them about once a week, always washed them in cold and hung to dry until my next visit an employee told me to wash and dry them like normal with all my other clothes. Should have never taken the advice. Now the only thing I can do in them is spin class because they need pulled up all the time. No running, crossfit or yoga. I think I've owned them for maybe a year. Going to try a different style in hopes for better luck because I hear such great things about these clothes.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love the compression that these pants give but I have noticed that overtime the pants get looser and looser. I called the store and asked them if this is suppose to happen and they said no and that I am not the first to complain. I asked the store if they thought I should have gone down a size and they said no. When you spend $128 on a pair of pants you don't expect the pants to get looser overtime. I liked the pants because I like the held-in feeling but they don't give me this feeling anymore.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The All The Right Places pant and crop are the greatest fitting, most flattering, and practical pant. I am a lifter and a former collegiate athlete and these are MY FAVORITE pants!!! PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE bring them back in stores! The lines are stitched to flatter literally every body type and the side pockets are essential for carrying my phone during my workouts. It is essential that for your lululemon pants to function properly for you, you NEED to be in the correct size. Make sure you are going in and getting sized by and educator because if you feel like your pants are loosening...you are probably in a size to big. I typically wear a size 6 everywhere else in the world but I am a 4 in lulu and all my pants function perfectly! My only feedback for the All The Right Places Pant in particular is to make the tapper down by the ankle tighter. It is loose on most people that I have seen and looks better snug. I have hundreds of lululemon pieces and being the gym rat that I am I really care about what I put on my body and want to make sure that it functions well. THESE ARE THE DREAM PANTS! I was extremely disappointed when you made them online only. It does not allow people to try them on in the stores and experience their greatness! (and make sure they are getting in the right size).

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: As an avid lulu wear-er, I was excited to try these pants when I found them in store! However, after a few wears/washes per the instructions, I found that these pants stretched out around the waist and ankles - this is not the experience that I have had with other pairs and extremely disappointed in their performance. As a yoga teacher and avid runner - I would not recommend these.

column6: I loved these leggings and thought they were extremely flattering to wear. however, after only a month of light wear (at max 3 washes, hand wash and air dried) these leggings already have extremely noticeable butt piling and also do not hold their original shape. BEWARE as much as you love these in store, they will be a waste of you money and you will be annoyed and disappointed. i can't wear them anymore because even when im walking i need to pull them up and readjust every five minutes.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: I didn't even get to wear it to the gym yet
column6: I was VERY skeptical and read so many reviews online before finally cringing and purchasing these pants. The only reason I did was because I love the high waist, the no front seam, and the side pockets, plus I tried it on in store and it was great. When I got them in the mail I was happy and tried them on once to make sure it fit. I tried them on again today just casually at home and then I noticed the seams on the waistband are already coming undone...HOW?! I did not once work out in them or even wear them for more than a total of 5 minutes... I didn't believe the reviews that kept reporting the seams problem until I am now writing this review to sadly say the same thing :(

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Cute but disappointing after a few wears
column6: These are super flattering pants, and I started off wearing them once a week over the last 3 - 4 months (so maybe 10 - 15 wears and washes total?) and they are not holding up. They lost their tightness or got too stretched out or something and I find myself constantly pulling them up while I'm running. (And no, my size and shape hasn't changed during this time!) Really disappointing because they look great and I like the material a ton, just wish they were holding up better. I'm about ready to give up on them, and for $128 you'd expect to get more than 3 months of use!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I have about 6 pairs of lulu leggings and don't have this issue with any of my other leggings from here. I love the cut of these pants but they don't stay up at the gym. I bought them in a store and were told they were true to size yet the next time I went into the store I over heard the workers telling customers to size down on this particular pair of pants. column6: I was absolutely in love with these pants- fit feel and look! column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I am 5'3", 118 lbs with a trim, athletic build. I bought these pants and THEN read the reviews and was dreading the constant pulling up and tugging. Well, I have run over 30 miles in these pants and have not had to tug once. The seams are still intact and the best part of all is that Lulu seems to have found the Holy Grail of yoga/running tights: a smooth, anti-camel toe crotch!! AMAZING.
AND these pants look KILLER on and make my butt look great. I love these pants and am going to buy more. Thank you Lulu!!!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I just purchased these this week and wore them for the first time today. I have definitely worn myself out constantly pulling them up. Love the style, but they continuously slide down. column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I really love the pair that I got in black, so far seams are holding up, no pilling, and a little small bit of stretching out. The fabric is super nice, breathable, sweat proof and doesn't stick to lint. Sometimes the waist is loose and other times it kind of cuts in which is odd. I wish I would've gotten them in my normal size 4 instead of 6, I was going to get these again in midnight navy in size 4 but they sold out :(

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These leggings are the most amazing pants ever. I feel so slim and controlled in these pants while in class, at the gym, or the store. The side pockets are perfect for leg day at the gym or even jogging. I don't understand the negative comments on these pants, they are amazing and I always recommend them to my friends. Must have!!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was so excited to receive these leggings because I have never been disappointed by a pair of Lulu leggings, but unfortunately the quality just isn't the same as other pairs that I own. The fabric doesn't feel as comfortable and the bottom of the legging is very baggy. I ordered the same size that I usually order so I'm not sure why these didn't fit the same.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These were my favorite leggings for the past 2 months that that I have had them but I recently noticed that the seams are starting to break only after 2 months of having them. Not only are the seams coming out but they are starting to pill. Keep in mind I followed the washing directions EXACTLY and have only washed them 3 times. I am so disappointed because these were my favorite lulu leggings by far. Would not purchase again in the future unless they did something about those seams.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey NATTY2008,\nThanks for reaching out. I can understand your disappointment that the seams have started breaking and I would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way.', 'LL_response_date': 'February 2, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: For the first few months I had these pants I LOVED them. They're super comfortable, look great, and the pocket is so helpful at the gym or just running errands. However... after about three months these pants have started to fall apart. They are still wearable but have seams coming out in the crotch area and pilling on the pockets. They have also definitely stretched out and are now too big for me. This is all with following all of the instructions for care given by Lululemon. It's disappointing because I expected them to last well over a year when I initially bought them and all of this has happened within a year of purchase. If you end up buying these I would suggest size down because they will definitely stretch out!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Sall,\nWe hear your disappointment with the seam splitting and retention loss on your gear and would like to chat some more. An email is coming your way so we can follow up and help.\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 31, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I am not new to Lululemon over the years ive owned over 20 leggings, workout tops, many define jackets, many sports bras. I LIVE in lululemon clothing everyday Im always praising the styles and quality to friends and family and justifying the overly priced items. I have many pairs of wunder unders, aligns, speed tights, fast and free, in movement and few other style leggings lulus are all i wear. I have leggings in fleece, luxtreme, nulux, nulu, luon materials and have made pairs last years. This was my most anticipated pair of lulu leggings absolutely obsessed over this pair for 7-8 months before i got it as a present from my bf.
I got them in my regular size 6. I have worn a size 6 in every pair of my lulus never had any sizing issues. Wore these ONCE to the gym, They were FALLING and Rolling down my waist the wholeee time after i initially put them on. later that week i noticed pilling ALREADY just from wearing these to class and the gym a few days little lint balls all over the hemming. NOT to mention within a week they have stretched to what feels like a size 10!?!?! today i noticed a small HOLE while putting these on.... From where my nail had snagged against the material.. IT RIPPED from my nail?? ive always had long nails and never had lulus rip from my NAIL! Its been a week and these leggings look old and worn out and now ripped from a scratch. I have never been soooo DISAPPOINTED in lulu before. I live in their leggings i take care of the material i know how to wash and clean it. I am so disappointed in these leggings because they could've been amazing for me they look great on the style is their best but their quality was NOT WORTH $128. VERY UPSET by these and im the biggest lululemon fan. Couldnt believe how poorly these held up and only lasted a week.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Nars2014,\nSorry to hear that your All The Right Places Pant II *Online Only 28" isn\'t holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 31, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I have 3 pairs of these and used to be obsessed. They were the only legging I would wear both for working out and for running errands (bonus for the pockets!). After about 4 washes (and following Lulu's directions for washing to a tee), they are completely stretched out and the seams are falling apart. I'm so disappointed considering Lulu bases their high price point on the claim of quality and these don't even come close to meeting expectation. Also, I tried to bring them back to the store to exchange but these are unfortunately only sold online.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey mergoround,\nSorry to hear that your All The Right Places Pant II *Online Only 28" isn\'t holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 30, 2018'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: For the first three wears, these leggings fit like an absolute glove. After those three times, the leggings begin to fall apart-everything from the waist band being stretched out to the seams of towards the calves area being to show wear. In retrospect, these leggings are great for the first couple of wears or so, but after that take caution & enjoy them while they last because pretty soon they'll start looking dingy. Such a total disappointment that the quality in these is a miss, because the high rise is ultra flattering!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
Let's be honest. The lines on these pants are amazing. I've looked high and low, and there's nothing like them anywhere. So this is how I justified my purchase. However, I see what people mean about the stretching. For me, it's happening in the waist/just under the butt. I think it's a combination of the fabric being flimsy and the fact there's no middle seam in the front. It seems like the thigh seams (which MAKE these pants) actually contribute to pulling the waist down (the seams are stiffer/hug the thighs, while the whole front of the waistband doesn't really have seams and so can be tugged down by the thigh seams).
That being said, here is my take. I ordered my regular size and worked out in them. Yes, I was tugging them up. Yes, there is a little gap at the top of the waist. No, I don't feel super compressed in these pants. But they still look great and move freely with me. As a comfy/everyday pant, I don't mind tugging them up now and then because of how awesome they make me feel and look. As a workout pant, I'm not a huge fan. So I'm wearing them to hang out/run errands, which basically means I'll wear them all weekend and every night after work. More than I wear my workout pants, so I'm not upset.
As for sizing down, I felt a lot more compressed in the size down. I didn't notice any major differences in coverage--these pants passed my squat test in my regular size and in the size down. But I will say my movement felt more restricted. If you want to feel compressed, you might like sizing down. I personally felt a little like a stuffed sausage and noticed the V at the top of my legs was much more pronounced in the smaller pants. I imagine if I wore them for a long time, they might feel a little itchy, that's how tight they were. It wasn't that the smaller size was wrong, per say. Just a different fit, and probably more solid for working out. But I am glad I stuck with my regular size. They are not as fitted as many of my other pants, but so what. They look awesome.
As for the quality, I am keeping an eye out because of all the complaints I have seen. But I did wash these once so far and haven't noticed any pilling or any seams coming undone. Let's just say I am cautiously optimistic. Overall, I would say if you really like the look of these pants, give them a shot. I've been back to the store a couple times trying to decide whether to get a smaller size or whether to go with a different style, and I'm sticking with these in my regular size, hoping for the best.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought these pants in store (over the holidays when they carried a few pairs in store) to wear generally and very lightly since they are so flattering. I have only worn them twice, both times I did not exercise or bike to work in them, and washed them on the store's recommended settings and left them to air dry, as I do with all of my leggings. I own a sizable collection of Lulu items, and have successfully taken care of all of them for years, one trusty pair is going on 4 years and they are almost pristine! I've never had quality problems with any before, even the ones that I cycle daily in or wear to the gym. However, with this pair of All the Right Places Pant, I immediately noticed my hems were getting fuzzy all along the outside seams and there are small strings sticking out of 2 different seams, a small hole on the middle of the thigh on one of the legs and pills already starting to develop on the pockets. This was really surprising since I have never had a pilling problem before- I generally only wear my yoga pants with tops that are also lulu/not cotton. The pants are so flattering and cute, I really loved them until these problems started coming to light. I am worried that Lulu's products are declining in quality since these are the newest ones I own and have the problems with- I am hoping it is just an anomaly.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: If you are trying to decide whether to buy these - DON'T.
column6:
So, I went back and forth about whether to buy these for so long. I wanted to like them so bad. I have some full-on luon wunder unders that I love and wear constantly. They are size 10, I am about 6'1" and they fit me perfectly, even through about a year of washing and drying and working out in them, they have never lost their shape or tightness, and their material has never lost its durability.
I wanted a new pair so I would have some other leggings to rotate out, and I figured I'd try a new style. The lines and shape of these leggings seemed like they would look good on my long legs. I read through the reviews on these leggings for multiple days, trying to decide whether to listen to the few positive ones, or the many abundant negative reviews. Being the person that I am, always trying to be positive despite the obvious logical decision, I went against my best judgement and decided to order a pair. Despite the reviews saying to order a size down for when the leggings lose their tightness, I ordered true to size (a 10), and thank God I did because these things are SO. FREAKING. THIN. If I had ordered a size smaller, I think they would have ripped.
I loved the line accents and the intended style/shape of the leggings, but I kid you not, you could see STRAIGHT through every inch of them. And I'm not talking about the little squat test you do to see if you can see your underwear when you bend over, like I could stand straight up with no tension in the leggings at all and you could see every little freckle on my thighs and every minor dimple in my backside. Like these things left nothing to the imagination. The material is AWFUL. So thin, so flimsy, I can't even imagine trying to run, do squats, lift weights, do yoga, or do literally anything in these. I could see exactly why everyone said the seams were falling apart and the leggings weren't staying up after just one wash. These things are more flimsy than the $15 pair of leggings I bought from target the other day, and these are $130...
I am extremely disappointed, and really wish I would've listened to all the negative reviews instead of hoping that somehow they would magically work for me when they didn't work for 95% of the other people that have bought them! If you're reading this, please take my advice (or keep scrolling and read the advice of countless others) and save your money! Either go with another brand, or buy a different pair of lululemon leggings, because these are just not the way to go.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I absolutely LOVE these pants. Everything about them is amazing.... the fit, the fabric, the pocket.. obsessed! They are sweat-wicking and make me feel cool even during my sweatiest workouts. Oh and they make your legs look SO good. I'm so sad to see that after 3 washes there were quite a few areas where the stitching is coming off! I followed the care instructions to a T too! As a curvy girl, it's hard for me to find flattering leggings so It's unfortunate because I thought I found the "one." :/ Do better Lulu! Especially for $128+.

column5: They're okay, I hoped for more
column6: I got these leggings about two weeks ago. I haven't worn leggings in about three years because I've been so self-conscious about getting camel toes, and these did fix that problem. They also were really flattering and made me feel good about showing off my lower body. However, I've worn these leggings about 8 times since then, and they're already becoming looser. I have to pull them up all the time, even when I'm just walking around campus and I just feel like it wasn't worth the $140. I'm a little disappointed because I decided to wear leggings again, decided to go with what I had heard was the best, and it just wasn't living up to the standards.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I've got 10 pairs of Lulu pants - several of which have lasted me 5+ years...and THESE didn't even last me 3 months!! There must be some differences in construction from a few years ago. I finally caved into the sales pitch that these pants are the "toughest, strongest, most durable pants we make" from my local lulu store...and because I liked the structured feel to them, I bought them. And I have to say that they functioned great, until they ripped for no reason in the leg... I'd expect this from a cheap $20 pair of cotton lycra yoga pants, but not from $150 Luxtreme "toughest pant" Lulu's!! Lulu please make this right. I've been a loyal diehard for years...but this latest pair has me questioning whether I should start looking elsewhere. If anything these pants were too big on me, not too tight. I always get told I can buy their size 4 but I prefer the 6 - little more comfortable.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These are by far the best leggings I've purchased from lulu. I only buy lulu leggings as I've found they are the only ones that fit me well. Would totally recommend these because there is no seam in the front which makes them super comfy and they look great on. I only wish they had more colors and styles without the seam in the front. Im 5'9 and got a size 4, they fit good and were the perfect length too!!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I've purchased many Lululemon clothes in the past but I just recently purchased these leggings and I absolutely love them because I can put my phone in the pocket on the side while working out and my phone actually stays in. Compared to other brands you will not find one as high in quality compared to these All The Right Places Pant II. I also loved the seaming all over the pants because they show off your curves and your legs in the right ways. Overall, would recommend to anyone interested in buying these!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I'm in love with these pants. I can't get enough. They are a perfect fit and they are so flattering on. I have been asked by many people what kind of pants they are. I have not one bad thing to say about these pants. I would recommend them to anyone. I know the price seems a little high but I promise they are more than worth it. Buy one pair and you'll want them in every color.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I've purchased three pairs of these pants in stores (before they were online only), because I loved the fit and high waist. However, all three of them now barely fit around my ankle. As one of the higher priced styles of lulu leggings I'd expect these to last longer.
Hopefully Lululemon will come out with another style with similar styling but more endurance. I can't find a style with as flattering fit from them but can't justify the $ given how quickly they deteriorate. Such a shame...
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Allison0910,\nSorry to hear that your All The Right Places Pant II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 25, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: At first, I LOVED these pants! My husband bought them for me for a birthday gift. I was so impressed with the way they stayed up and held everything in. He loved my reaction to them, so for Christmas he bought me two other pairs. After a few months, I noticed they would stretch out so easily that while I was working out I constantly had to pull them up. It was like the compression type fabric only lasted for a month. Now, less than a year later, all three pairs I have are incredibly annoying to wear during a workout. I am tugging at them the whole time!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Favorite lulu leggings. Read reviews before selecting size!
column6: My favorite lulu leggings, hands down. I've had them for about a year and still love them. I usually opt for a firm, flattering compression fit that holds everything in place and can stand running and intense cycling and HIIT, as well as deep squats and weight training without being see-through or sliding down. These have a side pocket that is large enough for iPhone8+ which is an added bonus. The flattering seams and lack of front center seam are excellent features. Love the material too -- not to slippery, not too thick or thin. SIZE NOTE: I am a 4 in all lulu leggings. I originally bought a 6 in these because they were tighter, but exchanged them for a 4 and am so glad I did. They did sort of permanently stretch a tad, and now are perfect. So if you are between sizes order down, and if not order your true size or consider trying on the smaller size too. You'll be glad you did after a few wears and washes!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love the All The Right Places Pants and have them in almost all colors! These are by far my favorite workout pants! I am a bodybuilder and do weight training on a daily basis. These pants have just the perfect amount of compression on your quads and glutes so I feel very supportive! I’m 5’2 so these pants are a bit long on me, but I don’t mind them gathered at my ankles. I do wish Lululemon would makes these in the 25" (7/8) length!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: So freaking sad to be writing this review since I love lululemon and have been wearing their attire for years. I bought pants identical to these not even a year ago in a burgundy color and a hole has started to form in the mesh! I take extremely good care of everything I buy from LL and always follow the care instructions. I was super disappointed considering the price point for these pants. I definitely expected them to last as long as all of the other products I have from here. Sad day! If anyone from LL is reading this, fix your mesh, please!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Krave,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 7, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I needed a more "wintery" legging, since my other faves are better for the summer (fast & free) and THESE ARE UH-MAZING. If you are between sizes, DEFINITELY size down...they will stretch (same with fast & free). But you will be soooo "held in" exactly the sensation they are looking to produce. They hold in (derrrr) all the right places!!
Try them. You have nothing to lose!!
They will become your new favorites!
(Please don't stop making them, Lulu?!)

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I got these pants in March or so an they were great at first!! Definitely my go to pants. But after 4 or 5 months they stretched out quite a bit and wouldn't stay up like they used to. Would of loved if these pants held up a bit longer!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These are my favorite leggings from Lulu. The fit is great, they're very flattering, and I love the pockets. I wear these both in the gym and just running errands/running around town. Oh and also, they are not see through at all! Which I have a hard time with normally bc I've got a bigger butt/legs. I love these pants so much I own several pairs (both crop and pants).

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Great pants BUT they stretch so size down!
column6: I've had these less than two years and unfortunately they've significantly stretched out. I'm 5'9'' 145 and normally a size 6 so I got these in a 6. They felt fine in the store, but after 4-5 months of wear for crossfit classes and running they started to noticeably stretch so I have to keep pulling them up (both in the legs and the waist). I later got these in the crop length and sized down to a 4 at the advice of people at the store and my previous experience with stretching. The 4's have held up great and I've not experiences stretching out. Definitely size down if you don't want to have to keep pulling them up during your workouts. They're really expensive so I am disappointed in the pants I have and can't really wear them as much as I'd like due to their not preforming the way I need them to. Wish I'd been advised to size down.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey thasdkepsa98,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 2, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought 2 pairs of all the right places ( a croped and a full lenght pant) because I loved them so much when I first received my first pair. But after 4 months they have streched out and fit loose. I bought these because of the compression it promised, too bad it only lasted the first few months.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
About me: 5'7", 135ish pounds and normally a size 27 in jeans. Size 4 in all Lulu pants. I strength train and weight lift, with the occasional yoga.
These are the PERFECT leggings for training and weight lifting. The compress perfectly (I love the look of aligns, but they lack compression and are not meant for training). The high rise goes perfectly with a sports bra, long line bra, or tied tank. The side pocket fits my iPhone 8 Plus (with case) just fine. The no-camel-toe sells these pants for me. I'm always self conscious in my WUPs or In Movements.
And bosenberry?! I was hesitant. I'm typically a black leggings kind of gal. This color is ON POINT. It's very close to black cherry. The dusty, dark, royal plum color is GORGEOUS with a white or black top. I really think any pant could show some sweat, and these maybe showed the teeniest bit, but it wasn't bad like other colors. They were squat proof too!
I own three pairs of ATRPs. Two of which were bought used but in EUC. I have noticed the seems on the cropped used ones I own to start unraveling. I have not noticed it on the other two pairs.
Lulu, please don't stop making these pants and PLEASE make them more available. More colors, more stock on popular sizes!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These were my very first purchase from Lululemon. I was so excited, since hearing so many great things about the brand. I LOVED these pants! and took extra care of them. I only air dried them, washed them about once a week (if that). They started falling apart after a month of purchase, the lining started fraying and then the hip and crotch material completely stretched out and has become see-through. I called customer service and was given the option to mail in and receive credit, however I am so disappointed in the quality of the material and the over pricing that doesn't match what they advertise. I am unsure if I even want to bother going through the process.
column15: stretched out thinned out frayed lining

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought these pants (2) in purple and black IN June and loved them!!! BY August the black pair was totally stretched out in the waist and crotch area and now the purple pair are too. Very disappointed in th life span of these pants. The quality of Lulu material has really gone down hill in the last 3 years! :(

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The compression is amazing. I adore the fit! Best leggings/pants I've ever owned!! I do have to keep washing them because they tend to stretch a bit, so definitely size down! The pockets are awesome too! I have these in black and the crop is a blue, and I can't wait to add more colors to my collection! My fav lulu pant for sure!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I bought my first pair of "All the Right Places" crops about 2 years ago and since then, I have added several to my collection, including 2 more pair of crops for the summer and 3 pair of pants for the winter. I also bought two pair for my sisters as Christmas gifts. Why this particular style when Lulu offers so many varieties? First and foremost, my cellphone fits perfectly in the side pocket and stays put no matter what activity I am doing. The snug fit and high waist holds you in without feeling constricted. I wear them constantly both for bootcamp and casually and they are holding up beautifully (I always line dry them).
I have been in the habit of checking to see if they offer new colors and lately, I noticed they weren't available online, at my local store, or at a store on Broadway Ave in NY where I was visiting. I'll admit feeling more bothered than I should have about not being able to buy any more of this style of pant. I am very happy to see them available online again; albeit in only 2 colors. Lulu, if you plan to discontinue these pants, please don't do it before offering a new style of pants with a side pocket, snug fit, high waist, that holds up through several washings! Or....you could just keep offering the "All the right places" pant!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I really wanted to love these pants, they are super comfortable and flattering. But, this is only the 2nd time I have worn them and there is already a rather long thread unraveling from the seam/stiching on the front of my leg. I am very careful about washing my Lulu items, and I am extremely disappointed to see that these pants are coming apart after only 1 wash.....especially for the price.....

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I bought these in May and when I first got these I absolutely LOVED THEM!! They were literally the best workout pants I had ever bought. The fit was amazing - the compression around the waist was amazing. For training and interval running/training they were absolutely perfect.
Cut to 6 months later and they have totally stretched out. When I'm running they fall down - so I need to constantly pull them up, which is infuriating.
It's frustrating and sad for me... As these pants were so amazing when I got them, and now I need to look at getting a replacement after only having these for 6 months.
I would have thought that given the price tag, these would last longer.

Unfortunately, after wearing them a few times, the seams started to unravel and a hole began to form in the crotch area, so now I can't wear them anymore. I follow all the washing instructions. column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These are my favorite workout pants, and I see they are all sold out, I was coming to buy more pairs, please tell me you aren't discontinuing them!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Love these pants. I don't agree with any of the less then positive reviews on the All the Right Places Pant. These are hands down my favorite pants. They fit fantastic, hold up great and look great. My only complaint is that I have not seen them in any color besides black in quite awhile. Please bring back some new colors for fall...I'll buy them all.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I purchased these pants back in April in a purple color and loved them at first. I wear them roughly 1-2 a month and in July the seams started to unravel in multiple places, and a hole began to form in the crotch area. I follow the washing instructions to a tee and since they are rarely worn, I don't understand how they are falling apart. I tried to talk to someone at the store about them and they told me that I wear them incorrectly, which does not make sense at all, and is quite rude. The worker could tell I was upset, but brushed me off and did not care at all. I have gone in multiple times and have gotten the same reaction from the workers every time. I am very disappointed in the Lululemon brand right now because last year I had a problem with another pair of pants, and the workers didn't care then either.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Even though they were more pricey than the other pairs of pants, I got the chance to try these on & purchase them at my store when they had them for a very short amount of time. I've owned my fair share of yoga pants from here and haven't had the seams coming out be a problem before. Piling eventually happens but it happened so quickly and much worse with this pair even though I washed them to the directions, didn't put them in the dryer, etc. I went into the store to tell them about the problem and they said that it's "normal wear & tear." Very disappointed..

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I LOVE these pants! I wish they had them in other colors and prints...I would buy them all! These pants are amazing! Please make more!

column6: I loved these pants so much at first that I bought another 2 pairs. They all have stretched out with each wear. column6: When I received this pair of leggings a few months ago, I was in LOVE! They were so comfortable and the fit was incredible. column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
Hello,
I'm 5'5'' around 117 lbs (I wear a size 4), I go to the gym around 3-4 times a week usually to run. I have a thigh gap so I don't normally see any pilling on my leggings and I'm fairly particular about avoiding materials that are likely to pill. After owning several pairs, I'm fairly familiar with the care instructions so I've never experienced any other issues with my Lulus. I've always told my friends that Lulus are great quality and they last forever so they're worth every penny. But I purchased this pair in stores around early May, I've worn it 5-6 times and have washed it 3 times, by the second time I washed it I noticed pilling on the outer thigh area and at first I thought maybe it was a little blemish I didn't notice when I first bought the leggings but by the 3rd time I washed the leggings the pilling got a lot worse.
I was extremely disappointed, I've never had any of my Lulus pill and I've had some for years...I used to be able to recommend Lulus to my friends with complete confidence but after this experience I'm not so sure. I hope Lulus can go back to is original quality soon.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Erica0213,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 18, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was in love with these pants and tried them on in the store before ordering them online a few weeks later. They fit as usual, no complaints there. However, I noticed when I received the package that the pants had a strange scent, but assumed it was just from shipping and packaging and the warehouse and would come out in the wash. Nope. The smell is really poignant (sort of smells sweaty and crotchy) and I can barely wear these pants. A tiny hole also appeared on the bum area within the first one or two wears. Disappointed and would not recommend, and would love to get this stupid smell out so I could at least wear them some.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey sprunner,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'July 18, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: So I read the reviews prior to buying them and wanted to believe that somehow, the reviews were all wrong. Bad move! While they do stay in place, the "sweat wicking" technology must have skipped this pant. I absolutely LOVE the black pair I purchased, but now I'm wondering what to do with these $128 pair of pants I'll never workout in!!!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"

I used to buy a lot of Lululemon and this was my first purchase in the last 1-2 years. I am frusturated, disappointed, and now believe all the negative reviews I have read of the product.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I have no clue why these pants have such a low rating; they're THE best. I love how I'm sucked in no matter what activity I do! I'm obsessed with these pants and have them both in black pants and grey crops (both in a size 4). LOVE LOVE LOVE.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was really disappointed with these pants. When it comes to wearing them around town they are cute and comfy but they are not for running. I went on a five mile run and the entire way I had to constantly pull them up. They are definitely my size, I do not recommend these pants unless you're just interested in hanging out in them.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I loved these pants at first! I really need compression for working out, especially running, and I was told these had the best compression that Lulu offers. They were great in the store, great for a few wears, but after a few months they've lost ALL compression now. I've seen similar experiences reported by other reviewers, so I am always incredibly careful with them, always wash by hand and lay flat to dry. But now my Victoria's Secret Knockout Tights are more supportive, and they're less than HALF the price. Whhhyyyy?? For $140, the compression should last!

column6: I currently own six different pairs of lululemons pants and this pant is in my top favorites. I am especially happy with this pant; I haven't had any problems, even though I've already had them for almost a year, has the perfect pockets and length, and it fits my body type perfectly. So when I was looking at the lululemon website a few months ago I saw that it was being sold in dark charcoal and I got so excited since I've been wanting a dark gray pair of leggings for a while (all six of my pairs are in black). BUT THEY DIDN'T HAVE ANY SIZES (they were sold out of every size except one pair of 12 but I'm a size 4) so was very upset about this and saved it to favorites and have been checking consistently for them to come back in stock and they haven't, I'm afraid that they will never come back. I'm very sad about it. Please bring them back already. I would've given these pants five stars but the color selection isn't very good, with only 3 options.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
After saving money to buy myself two pairs of Lulu's that I heard great things about for years... I am sad to say that the reviews I've read are true, and I feel like I wasted my money.
I am an active mom of two who has a very demanding job where I travel a lot and have a 4hr daily commute to/from work. I bought the Align Pant as a pair of pants to travel in and occasionally work in. I am a fit woman, I work out and belly dance and I am muscular. My thighs do touch a bit and by the third time I wore the pants there were nubby bumpy "chub rub" fabric balls in the crotch area. And the pants got caught on my fingernail (I think I broke my natural nail by accident) and now there is a pull in the thigh area of the fabric. For pants that cost $90 I expected better quality and for them to hold up. I am really sad and disappointed in the fabric and would love to know what to do with $200 plus dollars of pants that haven't held up at all. It's a shame because the fabric feels nice against your skin, but unless you live in a bubble where nothing to touch the pants and don't have an ounce of fat between your thighs, I don't know how to avoid from having the fabric get this way.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Pants seem to lose their structure+
column6:
When I tried a black pair of these pants on in my local Lulu store, I actually told the salesperson that these were the cutest pants I'd ever tried on in Lululemon. They fit like a dream. I even came home and ordered them online in navy I loved them so much.
Fast forward a week, and my black pair is so loose after wearing them to only a few barre classes (pretty low impact, so I'm not sure why they stretched so much) and out and about running errands afterwards, that I'm not sure I'll be able to continue wearing them. I wore the navy pair to barre last night, and I felt like I had to keep pulling up the waistband the whole time, and I ordered my usual size 4. It's such a bummer, because I was told they were a higher compression pant, and that they wouldn't lose their elasticity. I tried something different, but now I guess I know why I stick to Wunder Unders...

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I really contemplated making this review in the past few months. However, before I tell what's wrong, let me just say that I really do love these pants. The fit, the feel, the look - all of it is so nice and so unique. I was a head on Wunder Under buyer until I put these pants on and fell in love.
And it's because I loved them so much that I ignored the fact they were really not up to par with the price I paid. In the first week that I bought these, the seams stripped right along the inner thigh -where Lululemon pants usually do. I live far from my Lululemon store so I ignored this issue and tried to not let it get in the way of me loving the pair because the drive would have been so far to get them fixed. Then, they started to sag on my runs and I'd be forcing the pants to just stay on my dang hips with every skip.
I have a handful of Lululemon product and so I understand that the pants you buy are not meant to be impervious and require a certain amount of care for upkeep. I spend a good amount of money here so I do well to follow all these procedures to get the most life out of my "100$ work-out pants", that no one else can seem to know why I bought. I'm really fighting for you Lulu and your recent outbreak of bad quality items however, all of these reviews are making me realize that the problems I've been having or something completely not normal and definitely not worth the money I paid.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey YogiWogi,\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts with us today and follow up on the All The Right Places Pant II. Know that we stand by the quality of our gear and that this is something we'd love to get to the bottom of. I've sent you an email to follow up so we can work towards a resolution together. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'April 23, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I really like these pants. They definitely hug you and hold you in. The pockets are GREAT. My only criticism is that, occasionally, the top of the pants roll down. Overall the pants stay up - I never have to pull them up - the only adjustment unrolling the waistband.
I am a new mom, so I am not back to pre-pregnancy shape, but it makes me appreciate the high waist.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Bought these pants because I've seen so many in them and love the look as well as the pocket for holding my phone. However upon buying and getting home I realized that these pants are COMPLETELY SHEER, which is an extreme disappointment. I love the style and fit, however do not love going out in public being able to see my underwear straight through my pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey OSHO,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and are sorry to hear your gear isn't performing. Give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 so they can follow up and chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 14, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These pants hug my bum and legs amazingly well, and make them look toned. I also like the material - I'm not afraid to use and wash this pair repeatedly. Plus the pants are thick. I did find the calf/ ankle part to be loose, hence the 4-star rating. Hope this rating remains the same through time!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Beautiful color, but the fabric and quality... meh
column6:
I noticed the thread coming undone after the first use :( I purchased these in Nocturnal Teal (the color is gorgeous!), but seeing that they won't last a couple of washes is really heartbreaking....
I used them for my spin class, and the material made my legs feel really hot..... Perhaps they are not meant for spin?
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi PetiteLuluGal,\nOh my, I'm so sorry to hear of the unraveling seams going on with your All The Right Places Pant II *Online Only. We stand behind our gear and are eager to turn things around for you, so stand by—I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 11, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
So I love these pants. I love the tummy control and the "no camel toe" design. You can hike these pants up and it doesnt happen.
The one downfall of the entire collection for all the "All the Right Places" line is that there are like TWO colors to choose from. I went in store and got a pair of the dark blue, and the only other color is black. So while these pants are awesome, I am not about to buy a couple of these in the same color. So 4 stars because the variety sucks.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Great Pair of Leggings For Any Occasion
column6: I love these leggings! They are extremely flattering on my frame and never lost their fit when I've worn them over 50 times. I've worn them to class, out hiking, to the gym and just about anywhere else you can think of and I just love them! The only thing to be aware of is the sizing. I am between a 4-6 but usually order a 6 just to be safe. Thank god I did that with these because they're extremely fitting. Definitely worth the money!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: This is my first pair of Lulu's that I purchased. I've heard wonders about the brand, so decided to try for myself. I purchased a size 8 and the size is perfect for my build. Now, I've worn the leggings 2x since the purchase and the stitching on the back became undone even before washing it.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey tkcontreras,\nUnraveling seams are a major thumbs down and I'm sorry to hear of your experience with your gear. I'd love to lend a hand with some solutions so I've sent you an email that outlines the next steps. Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'April 3, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I am not big on brand names, but after several close friends recommended Lululemon I decided to give it a go. At first it was love at first sight. I really love the way I feel and look in these pants. I also love the very convenient pockets. I was told these were high quality leggings and worth every penny. This seemed to be true until a couple washes. The stitching started coming undone in several areas after less than a month of owning them. Sad because they are so comfy, but not holding up to the quality portrayed by the company. For the price, I would expect better.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey xmissjeycax,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I definitely understand where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear that your gear hasn't held up as expected. I'd love to turn your experience around and help make things right so I've sent you an email to follow up.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 3, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: My most expensive lulus and worst lulus! So comfortable until you try to walk with them on. I am constantly pulling at the waist to keep them up. Sizing is correct as it is the same size I wear in all my pants in this brand and was recommended in the store in Atlanta. I tried to take back to the store and they told me it wasn't a quality issue but sizing issue so they could not do anything! Doesn't sound like it based on other reviews. Waste of money.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Kpeck.\nWe're sorry to hear you're having to constantly pull up on your All The Right Places Pant II. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. Please give our GEC a call- 1.877.263.9300 as they'll be able make some recommendations about how to proceed.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 31, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
These pants have the makings of being great. Flat-lock seams bringing two different fabrics together to be the perfect balance of compression, in all the right places. *wink wink* They are lightweight, have a cool little reflective bit on the cuff for extra visibility. All of these things are great.
However, the main reason for buying the pants was that they came with pockets big enough to put my phone. I love doing cardio: running, and hiking. I like to be able to keep my phone on me. The stitching on one pocket came undone after 1 wash. I hadn't even worn them yet. I am exceedingly careful when it comes to washing my lulu gear. Cold, gentle cycle, like fabrics and colors- you know the drill- but I couldn't even use one of the pockets! I decided I liked them well enough I could keep using them for the other pocket. I don't have two phones right? 2 washes later, now the stitching on the other pocket has come undone. Now I'm left with an expensive pair of compression pants-which are nice- but lacking the main feature for buying them.
Come on Lululemon, stitching on these pockets is flimsy at best!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Hikingismycardio,\nSorry to hear that your All The Right Places Pant II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 30, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was attracted to these pants at first because I loved the stitching and loved how deep the hidden side pockets are. I was told that these leggings run true to size and "they are super snug at first, but won't give too much after wearing." Unfortunately, after wearing these pants only three times now - I will not be wearing them again (ESPECIALLY not doing anything remotely physical). I am constantly tugging on my pants and pulling them up. Even just walking down the street I find myself contorting my body so I can pull them up. I am really disappointed because they were my first pair of Lulu's.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi AEK526,\nWe're sorry to hear you're experiencing retention loss with your All The Right Places Pant II. We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 29, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These leggings hug my body perfectly, and they are so soft. However after only 2 wears (casual wearing, not even for workouts), these leggings started pilling all along the seams on both the inner AND outer thighs.. It's fuzzy all along the seams. I brought it in the store but the sales employee said pilling is caused by friction and I should be more careful with them... not very helpful. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this even though it fits really well and feels so soft.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi ENFP,\nWe're sorry to hear you're experiencing pilling with your All The Right Places Pant II. column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The most flattering pair of pants I own! I use them for weight training and HIIT. They feel like second skin but they are some down sides: 1. Not so good for sweaty workouts- I purchased grey color and I had a sweat spot in my crotch after my HIIT session.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I absolutely LOVE these, I run, I do weights, I do yoga and these work out great for everything that I do. The material is great and I have washed them several times and they are holding up great! I am confused by other reviews saying that the quality isn't that great and they aren't holding up after the wash. I follow the direction with the washing process and they look like new.
column15: i wish they had a bright colors to choose from.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: More like All The Wrong Places
column6: Let me start by saying I am incredibly picky about the feel of my clothing while running. Seams are my worst enemy, so I should have known from the start that these would not be my best friend. Love the waist and the slim fit of these pants. But the seams. My goodness. I would love to see something like this in a more basic tight without all the lines and seams, but keep the pockets. If you are an avid runner, safe yourself the trouble and skip these. You'll be glad you did.

Great to move in, have already gone running, boxing and yoga in them. Love the pocket and the flattering stitch details as well. Great legging and definitely worth the money!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I own several pairs of lulu leggings, but these are by far my favorite. I've worn them to Bikram yoga, cross fit and to the gym and I always seem to get compliments every time I wear them. Just make sure to wash them as per the tag, and they will remain in great shape. I've had my for two years and they still look brand new.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I could never understand why anyone would spend so much on yoga pants until I finally took the plunge and bought these amazing, figure flattering pants! I have absolutely fallen in love and am a "lululemonite" all the way. I have been spreading the news, but am so disappointed that they are falling apart after only 6 months. And sadly it appears that I am not the only one finding that the seams are coming apart. I hesitate to sew them myself and really mess them up and other than the seam they are in perfect condition, so I don't want to toss them and spend another $100+. I sure hope Lululemon finds a solution to this issue!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Exercise4Results,\nOh dear, I'm sorry to hear of the unraveling seams going on with your pants, and hear your frustration 100%. I'd love to learn more and find a fix for you, so I'm sending you an email to chat more.", 'LL_response_date': 'February 27, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: 5K's to Vinyassa flows this pant works great for guys
column6:
After quite a bit of research and a few chat sessions, I went to my local store and tried these compared to the only men's tight at the time (Tight Stuff). I was looking specifically for a tight for yoga as all the other pants tend to bunch or move and generally cause distractions.
The All the Right Places II was hands down a better fit and feel for yoga and I have found they can do it all including running and the pockets are great for taking your phone along but they lay flat when not needed. The Tight Stuff is designed for run and is far too compressive for doing yoga.
I got a 6 which equates to a men's small and after many sweaty yoga sessions and quite a few miles I have had no seem or stretching out issues as others have reported. The lack of a front seam is also a plus for guys and keeps the pants discreet.
The only down side for me is that the rise come close to my belly button and will roll a bit before settling into one place especially after that first down dog.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These pants are absolutely amazing. If you love the Align II pants, then you will love the style of these. They contour and hug the legs and hips beautifully. The side pockets also come in handy to hold your cell phone while training. I have worn these while strength training, doing cardio like rollerblading, and yoga. I have had zero problems with them so far. The only thing I dislike about the pants is the loose ankles, but I have that problem with a lot of pants. Rolling them up a bit solves this problem and I'm sure wearing the crop version of the pants would fix the problem as well. The pants are also true to size; no need to size up or down.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Amazing workout clothes but my pants always rip
column6:
Love these workout clothes, by far take over every workout clothes in my closet. They are so comfy and generally lasting. Look great on and stay put during a workout.
Only complaint is that many times my pants have ripped on the seams. Very frustrating especially after getting used to the pants, you have to give them up. They do offer to fix them but the time it takes to bring them in, complain, and get them back sometimes is too much.
Jackets and shirts have never ripped on me. Have many jackets that are 3+ years old and they still look brand new. Only mixed feeling because the seams on my pants do tear frequently.
I use these for running and weight lifting.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey SaritaAranda,\nI'd love to learn more about the ripped seams you're experiencing so I can help turn this around. I've sent you an email to follow up so we can continue the conversation - chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'February 21, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Although these pants are the complete opposite of my ride or die aligns, I still fell in love with them! The dark carbon color is gorgeous and the pockets make working out so easy. The stitching around your bum make your body look amazing in these! Definitely need to get them hemmed, just can't find the power to let go of them for more than a few days!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Only good for a short time
column6: I really did love these pants! I wore them all the time to work out at the gym and to do yoga. But over a few months the seams had just completely come apart especially at the crotch area which made it very uncomfortable to stretch and work out in. (I take extremely good care of my lulus and only hand wash them and air dry). I brought them into a store where they sent them back to a warehouse to get re-stiched. However, shortly after getting them re-stiched, the seams just came undone again. Not sure if I just have a defective pair or what, but these pants are definitely not worth the money if they come apart this easily.

Chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'February 19, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love the pockets and the fit makes me feel so confident. They really do hold me in all the right places! I repeat, there are amazing pockets!!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: When I first got these pants I absolutely loved them! However, after a few wears they became really loose. They do not hold there shape at all. They also started to pill a small amount at the upper leg area. At first I loved these pants and I'm disappointed that the quality of these pants did not live up to expectation.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey HelloHello,\nThanks for taking the timet o get in touch today. An email is coming your way so we can follow up on the pilling you've noticed on your gear.\nChat with you soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'February 18, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I got two pairs of these pants in store (the ones that aren't online only). Within the first TWO HOURS of me wearing these pants, the seams started to unravel and it was in multiple places. I called the store and told them that I bought these yesterday and wore them today, but the seams were coming apart. I asked if refunds were available for things like this. She said NO because I had worn them but they can do a seam repair in store. This bothers me for a couple of reasons... one.... if they're already coming apart within two hours of casual wear, why would I WANT to repair or exchange them? They're probably going to unravel again anyways. I'm so annoyed because I love the design and they look good on, but seriously... $128 for what exactly? Spend your money elsewhere. Greedy sales, poor quality, rude customer service.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Oceans,\nWe hear your disappointment with the unraveling seams on your gear and would like to chat some more. An email is coming your way so we can follow up and help.\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'February 17, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I signed on here just to review these pants. I have probably 20 or so pairs of pants from Lulu, but these are surprisingly the worst. I loved them when I first bought them. They were recommended to me by one of the associates. But, just after one wash, I am having to pull them up constantly. Also, looks like the material won't hold up in more than a few washes. I even have Lulu pants from 4-5 years ago that have held up better! Not sure if the quality has gone down in all the clothes or if it's just these pants as this was my most recent purchase. For $128, def not worth it.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These pants are fantastic and I wear them all the time. They are extremely comfortable and the side pocket is one of my favorite features. Unfortunately, I haven't had these pants for very long and they, as well as the side pockets, are fairly stretched out. The seams are also starting to unravel in places. Overall, these pants are great and I would recommend them but they have stretched out even though Lululemon pants aren't supposed to stretch out.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love these pants so much, the feel...the pockets...the fit..everything! Unfortunately, they do not last at all. After 1 wash the top stitching on the side pocket came undone. I was pretty sad because all of my other lulu lemon pants have been through the wash several times but come out like new! After a few more wears the entire pocket stitching is coming undone. It's not even a pocket anymore, just a loosely sewn on flap. Stitching is also coming undone in other areas. I'm really disappointed in these pants. I love them so so much but they are just not durable. After a 1 wash and a few wears, its time to retire these pants to the back of my closet. I was so ready to continue purchasing this style but it really is not worth the money.
