column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was so in love with my first pair of these that I foolishly got another right away. Even with diligent efforts (laundered and dried per tag instructions) the piling and tearing could not be avoided. Now most seams on both pairs show piling, and the side pockets are loose. The waistband loosens over time as well. In addition my newer pair tore in the middle of my thigh just a month after purchase. I'm so disappointed in the wear of these leggings because their fit was incredible, and they feel silky soft and breathable.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: LOVED LOVED LOVED these pants when I first got them. They were my go-to's. They fit super well and were comfortable. Overtime, the seems started coming undone and piling like crazy. Not to mention... these pants have stretched so much that I can't wear them anymore. At first I thought I lost weight, but when I went into the store to try on a smaller size (2), I grabbed a 4 as well (which is the size I own) just to see if they stretched. Yup these pants stretched an insane amount. They slide and I am constantly trying to pull them up when I work out and they used to fit like a glove. The crotch falls so far down and just too loose to wear now even to wear out and about. Makes me so sad. If you want a pair of pants that don't stretch or pile, go with a different style...

column6: Of all the Lululemon pants I own, these are hands down my favorite. The name "All The Right Places" is so fitting, they're extremely flattering and make your legs look great. They stay up on my body well and the high waist stays high which has been a problem for me in the past. I wear them pretty often and wash according to the instructions and I've had no problems. Definitely recommend.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These pants are as if the align pant and a running pant had a baby that was really handy and understood the need for pockets. If you are a runner, but love the yoga pant feel, you might like these.

column6: I fell in love with these in store because they make your butt look awesome. But after 1 wear and 1 wash, the seams came apart on the inner waist area. Not a big deal because it is inside, but I am worried about the rest of the pant coming apart. I keep wearing and washing and the stitch does not continue to unravel. Overall, really love the way these look. I am a size 4 usually but they only had a 2 left in store and it fit perfectly anyways.

Thinking it was a one time thing, I wore these to train in a few days later and continued to have the same issue. When I spend $120+ on a pair of pants I expect for them to stay up on me when I am working out.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Great for Weightlifting, Terrible for Running
column6:
Weightlifting: Highly recommended! These leggings are fantastic for weightlifting, circuits and rowing. I've worn them to five crossfit workouts and loved them. They're very comfortable, I don't overheat and they look great. One of the seams has frayed a small amount, likely from repeatedly dragging the bar, but it doesn't bother me.
Running: Do not recommend. I've worn these running to the gym (about 1.5 mi) a couple times and had to pull them up a minimum of 4 times every time. Incredibly annoying. If you put anything remotely heavy in the pockets (like your iPhone), it exacerbates the issue.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Should Have Listened to Previous Reviews
column6:
I had read reviews prior to purchasing these pants that they ran big. The sales associate assured me that I would be a size 6. (Im 5'2", 135lbs) I told her I am a small and she said yes you are a six.
All the pockets are great except I can't put anything in them because the pants are already falling off me with no weight in them If I add my phone it is all over. I have hips so I was hoping they would stay on but they fall off my hips and rear. There is no drawstring to even help the situation. I am constantly pulling up my pants. I can't get past a mile without pulling up my pants let alone wear these on long runs. I wanted to love them better after one wear they were super lose. I will now be trying to swap these on Runners Swap or gifting to a friend. Big waste of my hard earned money.

column6: i loved these leggings, at first bought a 2 because i'm usually a 2 at lulu, but i ended up getting a 4 because they fit better in the butt and thighs but a little loose on my ankles. Second time i wore them i wore them to school, no strenuous exercising or moving in them and i notice pulls all down the sides. They were so comfortable but the quality is so poor for the 128$ i spent on them. Such a joke.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi leggingseveryday,\nSounds like you may be experiencing pilling down the seams of your All The Right Places Pant II. We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 12, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I LOVED these pants - past tense. I have two pairs of crops and one long length pair. After receiving another full length pair for the holidays, the seams started coming apart after ONE wear. It hasn't even been a month and I am so disappointed in Lulu and their quality of what used to be my favorite pants. :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey BoulderRes5678,\nWe hear your disappointment with the unraveling seams you've noticed on your All The Right Places Pant II. An email is on the way so we can follow up and help.\nChat with you soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 11, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I love these. I get a little salty with lulu for not producing more colours of these. I use them for lifting and o m g. Little details make all the difference here. The stitching throughout the pants accents all of my best assets and provides an extra boost of confidence. The high waist band provides a little extra support (and hides my carb belly on leg days). I prefer the full-length to the crops, myself. I had a pair of these have seam issues. I took them to lulu and they took care of me. These are the best. hands down. Please make these in green again!
If you're on the fence on sizing, i'd recommend bumping up one size.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I want to love these leggings but the waistband has completely stretched out. When I bought these they fit perfectly but after wearing them a few times the waistband is much larger than it was in the beginning. I own many other pairs of lulu leggings, and I love the way the seams lines look but now I have to pull them up every couple steps
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi marenhildreth,\nWe're sorry to hear the waistband of your All The Right Places Pant II has stretched out. We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 5, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: This pant seriously fits in "all the right places". It's snug in the perfect areas to accentuate your legs/butt and is long enough that it kinda scrunches on the bottom, which I like! I love the pockets and line designs on the pants too. These are my favorite for the gym and for running around.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Loved these pants when I tried them on in the store, the fit is perfect and SO flattering. Unfortunately, after the first wash, the seams began unraveling and piling. Unfortunate to spend so much on pants that won't likely make it more than 3 months.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi ligockrm,\nWe're sorry to hear you're experiencing pilling with your All The Right Places Pant II and that the seams are beginning to unravel. We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 5, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was incredibly excited to receive these leggings, but I immediately ran into confusion when the color was much more purple than the pictures, or the name of the color, portrayed. Though I do like the color, I was disappointed by the contradiction. The larger problem I have with the leggings is their inability to stay up. This is my 4th pair of leggings, and they have all been the same size, and I have neither gained or lost weight since the purchase of these leggings, but this pair does not stay on my waist. I wore them during a crossfit work out, and I had to pull them up between each burpee. I am a gymnastics coach, and I was engaging in a game with my gymnasts, and I was unable to complete my entire tumbling pass because my leggings were falling off. I am incredibly upset to have spent so much money, and not be able to wear them for any functional purpose.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I've been searching for higher rise running tights because that's what feels good to me, I like the support. I had been faithful to the speed tights, but my only complaint was the waist didn't hit where I liked and these tights fixed that for me. I don't have any problem with them sagging or falling down, I do go down a size in tights (I get a 6 as opposed to the 8 I would get in speed shorts), so that could be why I don't have that problem. I also haven't had any issues with pilling or the seams and I wear these a lot for runs and casually. However, these are not my favorite for strength training or HIIT, when I bend forward the waist tends to roll down, but this could be due to the extra weight I'm carrying around the middle in all honesty. Looking forward to wearing these to run my 6th marathon in a couple of weeks!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I am obsessed. This is an understatement. I need a pair in every color. These are so flattering it is unreal. The pockets are incredible. I forget I have my phone in the side leg pockets because its so comfortable and it holds it just right. I literally love them. I have 2 pairs and its just not enough. Need. More. They are even long enough for my 5'11" self.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Did not live up to my expectations
column6: These pants were great at first, I love the way they fit and they look great. After the first time I wore them however, the seams on the waist began unraveling and the seams on the leg started pilling badly. When I ran in them for the first time, they did not stay up on my waist well and felt saggy. I had high hopes for these tights but they are definitely not worth the high price tag.

I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 4, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The great thing about these pants it that they are unique and flattering, and they never pill. I have put mine through the dryer multiple times on accident and they are holding up great. I would highly recommend these, although if you are short like me (5'2") then I suggest buying the cropped version of these. The only downfall for me it that they are long, but that doesn't bother me too much.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Nice Pants, but seam pulls easily
column6: Was super excited to get these pants for christmas and they fit great, but half way through my workout i realized the seam in the butt was pulling and continued to unravel even more throughout my workout (very awkward- was worried that it was going to become a hole the rest of my workout) i also noticed on the pockets the seams do not seem to be sown tightly which makes me think that those will unravel easily as well. I am very dissapointed with the pulling and unraveling of these pants since they are one of more expensive pairs and they are online only so it makes it even harder for return.
column14: the fit of the pants and the pockets
column15: seams get pulled very easily and they unravvel
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Kmae,\nYikes, I'm sorry to hear of the seam issues you're experiencing. We're all over a resolution for you, so keep an eye out for an email hitting your inbox soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 3, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought my first pair of All The Right Places Pant II couple months ago and really loved the fit! yesterday bought another pair in different color and didn't even got to the gym noticed seam on outside of my leg started unravel, so disappointed and embarrassing, had to go back home to change my pants. When you paying $128 for pair of pants expecting quality little netter. And I am huge fan of lulus , own approx. 15 pairs of different bottoms. :-(

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I was SUPER excited that my family bought me a pair of all the right places pants and all the right places crops for my birthday. I follow a lot of youtubers that own these items and since I'm on my own fitness journey, my family got me these to keep me inspired. I was obsessed with them and washed them realistically 5-10 times and they BOTH had a lot of pilling!!! They didn't have holes yet, so I donated them to Goodwill, hoping that even though they had pilling, someone would be super excited to be able to own them.
Reading other comments, I realized that this was not a problem with just my items.
Soooo heartbroken.
I wanted to love them, but I guess it's good to realize that yes, I can't afford these and yes, I can get the same quality for $100 less.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Hails1,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out and share your experience with the All The Right Places Pant II . We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 1, 2017'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I really loved these at first (Im pretty sure I have the first run), however after only two or three wears, I've seen the seams unraveling in THREE separate places. I hadn't even worn them to workout in, just for casual wear. I was really hoping these would hold up because I love the pockets, but considering the quality, I definitely wouldn't recommend them.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi yogapantenthusiast,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 29, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
This is my first pair of lulus so maybe my review won't be as trustworthy next to seasoned lulu vets.. but I got the All the Right Places leggings for my birthday and i can honestly say i will never buy another pant!
The mid rise is perfect for my frame as i am short waisted. I am only 5'2'' so the high waist ALMOST runs too high. The pockets are PROBABLY one of my favorite parts!! I personal train for a living and it makes it ideal for carrying my phone during training sessions! It's not only great for my profession, but when i workout, I can carry it around and listen to music during my own personal sessions! Much better than carrying it around in my bra! :p
The seems have held up well so far and I've lifted in them several times. no pilling yet. The thighs fit just right, however i did notice the seams pull against each other so instead of a straight line, it has a jutt out in it where the adjacent seam pulls. if that makes sense??? Which may just be because i have thicker thighs! Does not change the look or performance of these leggings however:)
I will be buying more soon!!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Purchased for my daughter, she loved them until seams started coming unravelled. Not worth the money, would not buy again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi there japm,\nI'm sorry to hear that your daughter experienced the seams unraveling on her pants. I'd definitely recommend reaching out to our GEC to chat to an educator about how to resolve this - 1.877.263.9300.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 21, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I'm disappointed by these lulu leggings. I bought them because I LOVE the align pant and the sales associate told me about these, so I tried them on. In the store they fit perfectly and felt amazing! I especially loved the pockets. I then wore them to workout and was very upset. The crotch was constantly falling and I had to stop running a few times to pull them up. I don't understand because the waist is snug and the next size down was too tight. I tried to bring them back, but obviously since I had worn them I was denied. I've never had this problem with any of my other Lulu leggings, so I'm thinking it's the slippery material. I wish Lulu had a workout guarantee!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Sekel89,\nThanks for taking the time to connect with us. I'm so sorry to hear of the retention issue going on with your pants, and would love to find a fix because we stand behind the quality of our gear. I've sent you an email and am looking forward to making things right.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 19, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought these leggings impulsively when I tried them on cause I loved the look and the pockets. Little did I know that I could not exchange them for a different size when they were way to big because they looked "washed". I did not wash them, in fact, I had only tried them on but the label looked "worn". Now I am stuck with leggings that are too big and to add to it the seams are coming undone! Brand new leggings that are unraveling! Would not buy these again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Liz1234,\nWe hear your disappointment and want to get you into gear that fits in all the right places. An email is on the way!\nChat with you soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 17, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Favorite Lulus to work out in
column6: I was a little nervous paying so much for these when I bought them in store, I have other Lulus that I like but these are by far my favorite purchase to date. They look really cute for leisurely wear but they are also really great for working out it. When I run in them I don't have any issues with them falling down or getting loose. Surprisingly for how thick the fabric is they keep me very cool when I am working out. I can't wait to buy a second pair in another color.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Not sure why the overall rating on these pants is so low, but these are one of the first pairs I bought and I loved them as soon as I tried them on in the store. The fit is true to size and so incredibly flattering. They hold you in and move with you while you're doing cardio or lifting. Sweat wicking is a plus. The black cherry color shows sweat initially but it dries super fast! These are the pants I tell everyone who doesn't own lululemons yet to start with. Please don't stop selling these!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These are my second pair of lulu lemon pants. I LOVED my first pair and continue to wear them to this day. Within a month, I decided I needed another pair but was influenced by an employee to go with the All the Right Places Pant. How could I resist? It made sense to get something different and they looked great! I took great care of them and washed them according to direction. However, within a month I could start seeing the balls forming. Don't try and pull because the seams will become further undone. I expected more for a pair of 130 dollar pants. I was willing to pay the money for quality clothing because I intended to wear these pants frequently. It makes the pants look cheap and I can't recommend to a friend! I love lulu lemon, but really am disappointed with these pants. Based on reviews, others have felt the same.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi nfay35,\nThanks for checking in and sharing your thoughts with us. Oh no! I'm sorry to hear of the pilling going on with your gear. We're all over a resolution for you, so give us a ring at 1.877.263.9300.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 15, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Absolutely love these leggings. I ended up getting them in a second color because I love the fit of them. I wear these for Soul Cycle and they're perfect-there's room to breathe yet still feel hugged. I'd buy these over and over.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Great Style, but Should Have Sized Down
column6: I love the fit of these pants, and the paneling, but I suggest sizing down! I thought with the luxtreme fabric I'd definitely need my normal size, but after the first was they stretched out a bit. Since then, the size has remained consistent, but they're still about half a size bigger than my other luxtreme pants. I'll definitely purchase another pair, but this time I'll be sizing down.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Great at first, but very quickly lots of pilling
column6: The leggings fit great, look great... until just a few times through the wash! The seams started having a whole bunch of problems, and all these little balls popped up in the fabric (I'm assuming that's what pilling means, based on the other reviews). I definitely would recommend checking reviews of Lulu leggings before purchasing to make sure this isn't a problem, feels like a waste of money at this point. Such a bummer, they were so great!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Montigny,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 13, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The first all the right places pant were way better. The ll slip down and start to sag on me... I have worn the same size pant for years and still try on multiple sizes every time I buy a pant. These are also shorter than the old ones..... Why are tall girls being forgotten?! :(

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
They are a great fit but they started to pill.
I bought them back in mid October and I've been washing them just as the care instructions say but they started to pill. Fuzz also tends to stick to them and I've had a couple people point it out.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey there KayKay18,\nOh no, I'm sorry to hear of the pilling that you've experienced on your pants. I'd love to chat more with you about this, so look out for an email headed your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 13, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: All the Right Places Pant - for Men
column6: I was in need of some compression tights for running and leg day, and my Nike Pro Combat tights were no longer giving me the feel I wanted. I called and spoke with customer service, and let her know what I was looking for and what other Lulu products I owned already ( Groove Pants and Dance Studio Pants) She recommended the All the Right Places Pants to get the fit and feel I was looking for and suggested the same sizing as my groove and DSP pants. The sizing was spot on and a size 6 was TTS for me and the same as my grooves and DSP pants. These pants have been great for running and have given me the feel and compression I was looking for. No tired legs or butt here after a hard run or heavy squats. I was concerned about the seaming based on reading others reviews, however I have not had an issue with any of the seam coming apart after wearing them for 6 workouts and 5 washes. They continue to hold their shape and compression qualities. The hip pockets are great for your phone while running and even fit my Iphone 6+, the pocket on the waist band above the butt is small but would fit a key or drivers license. The lack of a seam running down the crotch makes these pants more user friendly in my case, but I still suggest wearing the correct underwear(thong). These pants make me feel great, really show off your body and do not slip/roll down while working out. My first run out I cut my usual 3.5 mile time by 1:30 and I credit my new Lulu pants for making me feel amazing. I have received positive comments from others in my neighborhood that I see running daily, even referring one of my neighbor ladies, who regularly wears lulu to the All the Right Places pants.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought these in the Nocturnal Teal not sure how they would fit, but they've quickly become my favorite leggings! The seams are super flattering, contouring in the right places and I love the higher rise. There are just enough pockets to store keys and my phone when I'm going on a run. The fabric feels amazing on and I feel "hugged" in all day long. I train in them as well as run and have no issues with them sliding down--they just stay in place. Would highly recommend these as an all-around great legging to wear for any workout!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: I would want these pants during an apocalypse
column6: I absolutely love these pants. I went outdoor rock climbing in them the other day, I slipped and stupidly put my knee down and skid all the way down the rock. My knee was done, bloody and black and blue. THE PANTS DIDNT EVEN HAVE A PULL. These are 100% my go to for everything I do. So functional and flattering. If I had to choose a pair of pants for the end of the world, I"d pick these. A+++

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love Lululemon products and I'm always pleased with the quality and comfort of my purchases. But I bought these leggings about a month ago and I absolutely love them, except for the fact that they've been pilling all down the seams and it looks horrible! I really love these leggings and I want to wear them more but I'm scared I'll just cause more damage. Help!!!!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: I love them! Order a size down if you want a tight fit
column6: I do CrossFit and I love these. I ordered a size down from my typical size 4. I'm 5'8" and 136 just for reference - athletic build. I don't find myself messing with them even in the craziest WOD's. Maybe I pull them up now and again, but please tell me a pant that you don't readjust every once in awhile?

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Falls, Slips...Does Not Fit Where It Counts
column6:
I am disappointed in these leggings. I loved the design- the stitching makes my butt look amazing, and the side pockets are sleek and handy. The problem is, you're too busy, constantly pulling up your leggings to enjoy the amenities.
What upsets me the most, is that this was the first time I purchased leggings from Lulu. I am a runner/HIIT trainer so I wanted to purchase leggings that would work with me.
I wanted pants that would fit snug around the waist and stay up.
I don't suggest these leggings If you want to move around, work out, or run.

Tried on in store. Did bend test in dressing room, and BOOM, could see my thong right through them. :( Tried a size up, and not any better. These are best left on the shelf.
Come on lulu. You can do better.

column6:

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I had been wanting to get a pair of lulu pants for a while because I have so many crops and 7/8 pants and when I saw these I couldn't wait any longer! They fit very well and are incredibly comfortable. I have not had any problems with the seams. They are really great we'll made pants. The only reason I decided to give 4/5 stars is because I find that I have to pull them up frequently throughout my day even if I'm not doing any activity. It is slightly annoying at times, but I would never return them because of it. I love these pants!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: While these fit snug when first trying on, they fall down when trying to do any kind of hard activity. There's no forever drawstring so you can't tie them into place. I bought my TTS 4 and while running, I was constantly pulling them back up on my waist. They became all saggy after working out. These are better suited to yoga or if you're doing a low impact workout. IMO, not worth the $.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Traysea,\nThanks for taking the time to share your thoughts. Our gear has been pre-shrunk so it's stretchy but shouldn't be stretching out of shape. It sounds like you're All The Right Places Pant are fitting in all the wrong places. Keep your eyes peeled for an email headed your way so we can follow up and chat some more.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 3, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: I Want So Badly To Give These 5 Stars...
column6:
These pants fit like a DREAM, I have had them for about a month and wear at least once a week. So flattering and the lack of front seam makes these SOOOO comfortable to run in, and pretty much wear doing anything! The side leg pocket was the second biggest selling point for these pants, they fit my iphone 6plus perfectly for running and I don't have to wear an annoying arm band.
I was torn between what rating to give these... From an initial look of the fit perspective 5 stars all the way, from a quality perspective it's more of a 3. These are my very first pair of lulu pants and I'm honestly disappointed with how the material around the front holds up where the seams are, lots of piling and fuzz looking almost like they were pulled across concrete (which I could understand more if it were on the butt just from normal workout wear and tear), especially given my bf is an avid lulu fan and we religiously only wash their clothing with them on delicate cold and lay flat to dry.
Overall I will continue to buy for the side pocket alone until I can find ones made in a similar style and better quality. For $130 lulu please fix! And make in more colors (patterns even!)?!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Batesy,\nOh no! Pilling is definitely not what we like to hear. We stand behind the quality of our gear, so I've sent you an email to chat more and make things right.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 1, 2016'}

column6: Picked up these leggings last week and I absolutely loved them! The side pocket is big enough to fit my iPhone 7 Plus. These leggings are super comfortable and flattering, however, I was very upset when I recently noticed a small hole in one of the seams on the front of the leg. The pants have only been worn once and they haven't even gone through the wash yet. I wore them to workout one day--nothing too aggressive where I could have possibly ripped the seam during my workout. Not sure if the hole was caused by me or if it was like that when I picked it up in the store, but I am very disappointed that the fabric tore so quickly because I really loved everything else about the pants.
