column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
These were my first pair of Lulus. In fact, I liked them so much in store that I bought 2 pairs (1 was the All the Right Place I Pant). BOTH PAIRS have stretched out in the few months I've had them for and despite following the care instructions (not even tumble drying...AIR DRYING), they've pilled quite terribly. I will say that the II pair is pilling worse. I wear these for bouldering, which I do a few times a week, and I have to tug them up after every route I climb. I'm disappointed as I always heard that Lululemon was a premium brand. I can't be spending this kind of money on tights that don't stay up...I suppose I'll be back to shopping at REI for tights to climb in now. :(
2 stars because they look good when you first put them on...before the slipping of the waist happens... And I wanted so badly to love these tights...
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Deathorglory,\nWe're sorry to hear your All The Right Places Pant II have stretched and you're experiencing some pilling. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 29, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Love these pants! Do not pill because they are made of luxtreme, and are good pants for dance. A lot of people have said they size up in luxtreme fabrics, but I do the opposite. I'm 5'4" and 126 lbs and have a size 4 in these pants, and wear a size 6 in the Wunder Under and other luon pants. These are a little sheer in the knee but are pretty solid everywhere else. I have had these pants for nearly a year now, and still love them. The seam on the inside of one of the legs has gotten a little messed up but am planning on taking them in this week to get them fixed/replaced. These are super comfy and they shape your body really well; I feel confident in these. Overall, would recommend (especially for dancers!!)

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I own many pairs of lululemon leggings, and they have all been wonderful. I'm always on the website looking to buy a new pair and recently I bought the "All the right places pant", but sadly I was upset. The leggings fit perfectly and I would be 100% happy with my buy if the seam hadn't started to come undone. The seam on my right calf is frayed, and I have only worn the leggings 2 or 3 times. I'm always careful to follow the specific process of washing lululemon leggings, and I wish they wouldn't fall apart so easily. I've always stood by lululemon, and I'm said to say I'm hesitant to buy another pair of leggings.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Lscheide,\nThanks for getting in touch about your All The Right Places Pant II *Online Only. I can see that our GEC was able to offer you a solution and if there's anything else we can help with, please do not hesitate to reach out.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 25, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: This was my first lululemon purchase
column6: Bought All the right places pant as my first lululemon purchase after many people in my running group were telling me how wonderful they were. I have been running for years and wanted something that was better for those long runs. I have worn the pants twice now in the past few months of runs. As soon as I begin they show sweat behind my knee, on my bottom, in the crease of my legs. This is weird and I have never had this wish any other pants and its even happening in the cold. I really wanted to like them but i don't even feel comfortable leaving my house for anything in them. So I am hoping that it may just be the color? (i have pink) but I really have not worn them enough to determine if getting another color would be worth it.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: Finally found these in Bordeaux Drama at my local store and was SO stoked! I have a pair of black version I and the luxtreme is thick and they stay put...good seam, etc. So, I expected the same with a different color. Just wore them for the first time Tuesday for a gym session and when I put them on, I noticed right away that the luxtreme is much, much thinner and not compressive/supportive. Also, usually, I have to maneuver my Lulu tights to get them over my feet, but this pair pulled on too easily, and were baggy at the ankles! What in the world?? I was already at the gym with no extra pants, so I had to give them a try. My entire workout, I was pulling them up (I got my usual size 4), which was really distracting. The top rolled down, and in general I was just annoyed. Washed them in the sink with Woolite (cold water) last night and hung to dry. When I went to the drying rack, I noticed that they had a thread at the bottom of the leg that is frayed and coming undone and that the material is frayed like just wearing them this one time ruined the pants at the bottom of the legs. For $135, this is not acceptable. Now I have two pairs of $128 (plus tax) pants (Goal Crushers also) that have fraying and loose threads. I don't want to go into my local store because I don't want the attitude from the people there. Lulu, any remedy for these two pairs of tights???
column14: fit great until i started moving
column15: think luxtreme (not like the usual luxtreme)
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hello there Getitgirl,\nThanks for walking us through this and sharing your feedback. I'm so sorry to hear of the undone seams and stretching that you've experienced with both pairs of your pants. I definitely want to help you out and find a resolution. Look out for an email that will describe how we can make things right.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 24, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The pants don't hold up. I'm constantly trying to get them in the right place again. There are really loose now, and I only wore them for 4 months. So I can confirm: the pants don't stay up.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey CCAA,\nI'm so sorry to hear that your pants haven't held up as expected. We'd love to learn more about your experience and help make things right. Please keep your eyes peeled for a follow up email outlining the next steps.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 22, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was EXTATIC when I purchased these pants, for several reason. First being that they have convenient and stylish side pockets which are perfect for holding my iPod while on a run. Second, the mesh fabric at the bottom makes for a breathable run. Lastly the fit was originally supportive and stylish. Unfortunately this is my SECOND pair or Lululemons that have torn in the butt area AND began to pile after the first wash. SECOND PAIR. For the price I'm paying for these pants they should last me a lot longer than a few wears and a single wash. I am beyond disappointed and expect to receive my money back for these cheap leggings. My $24 pair of Target yoga pants are made better than these.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Gaerq92,\nThanks for touching base. Yikes! It's really too bad that you're experiencing a tear and pilling with your second pair of pants. We stand behind the quality of our gear and want to make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 22, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was so excited to finally have enough money to buy these and I am very disappointed! I find myself pulling them up every 5 minutes within an hour of wearing them because they stretched out so much. I can't find my receipt or tags so hopefully they will exchange them in store for something else. BUMMER
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Sma344,\nThanks for checking in with us. I'm sorry to hear of the stretching out going on with your pants, and I totally hear your concern. We'd love to make things right, so give us a ring at 1.877.263.9300.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 22, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love how these fit, feel and look. They are comfortable. I generally love them. Unless I'm running, then I hate them. I bought them for outdoor runs in colder weather and was really excited about the side pockets so I could ditch my armband. The bad news is that they just don't stay up as you run. I think if they had a drawstring they might be fine but they fall down and I was constantly having to stop and pull them back up. If you're going to buy them to just hang out in, do errands, etc. then I think they're great but for $128 I'm super bummed!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I've been a fan for awhile - ever since the kung fu pants I received roughly three birthdays ago. Over the years, I've amassed quite a bit of lululemon products. This one did me in. As a religious follower of fabric care labels, I have a ritual when it comes to workout gear. Although the care label suggests a low heat dry cycle, I do not take that chance. My workout gear go in the washer, swathed in netted laundry bags, under a cold gentle cycle. Following which, they are laid flat to dry. These pants were no different. But after just one wash, the bands at the bottom came loose and the once tight waistband - so important as I hate tugging them up during training - got slack.
column14: the petroleum blue colour is very attractive
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi there teemo,\nI'm sorry to hear of the stretching that you've experienced on your pants. I can totally understand why you'd be disappointed with this, so watch for an email that'll explain how to resolve this.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 12, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought these pants for a recent hiking trip, and they were great that weekend! However after I washed them, the seams around the ankles are coming loose and now they kind of loose? I have to constantly pull them up, and the seams looked ragged. Not what I expected from $120 leggings for sure...I love lululemon's products and I don't think these are up to snuff! I sent an email but I haven't heard back from support...someone help!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Megdub,\nThanks for checking in and sharing your thoughts with us. We're so sorry to hear of the unravelling seams going on with your pants, and want to make things right because we stand behind the quality of our gear. I've sent you an email so we can continue the conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 10, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: LOVE the pants, disappointed in the quality
column6: I initially bought these pants in July as a birthday present to myself as they were almost $120 leggings. I have worn them for weight lifting and light cardio and they have been my favorite leggings since buying them. The issue I have is that the seams are coming apart and pilling at the seams. Otherwise they are my favorite leggings I've ever encountered. They have a great fit, they are tight but incredibly flattering and the pockets are a huge plus. Yet, I am so disappointed in the quality of the leggings, I follow the Lululemon washing and drying directions exactly and they are still coming apart after only a few months of wear. I would still recommend them to a friend, but with the fair warning that you may not be getting your moneys worth from these pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey LD06,\nThanks for reaching out and sharing your feedback with us. I'm so sorry to hear that your pants have pilled and the seams are unraveling. This is something we'd love to chat further about so I've sent an email your way to follow up.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 9, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was so thrilled to find pants with pockets that could hold my phone while running. Upon trying them on in store, they appeared to fit great. As soon as I went for my first run, I noticed, as many other reviewers here (wish I had read these before purchasing) that the pants simply don't stay up. I would have returned them, but they were already worn. After just a few wears, they lost the form-hugging quality that made them great in the first place. I've been extremely careful to wash them cold with light detergent and no hardware (zippers, clasps, etc). But the seams have started to fray. I was expecting to have a pair of pants that I could wear all the time and would keep up with my active lifestyle, but I've had to limit how often I wear these so they don't literally fall apart. I've been happy with other lululemon purchases and in many ways the quality is great, but not with these pants. I'm very bummed I wasted the money.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi kyleerin,\nThanks for taking the time to connect with us. Yikes! I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing unravelling seams and retention with your pant, and I definitely get your frustration. I've sent you an email so we can follow up on this issue and make things right - chat soon!", 'LL_response_date': 'November 10, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Spend 90% of my time pulling them back up
column6:
I bought these leggings on Sunday and did a quick run through of some yoga that night and spend the entire time yanking them back up or fixing the waistband because it kept on rolling down when I would bend over.
I'm debating whether or not to return them because they are super comfy and look great, but as these are my first pair of Lulu's I'm very disappointed I spent what I did because I have cheap leggings that stay up and in place better than these.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Cute but not for working out!
column6: My mom got me these leggings for my birthday last month and while I love how they look and fit, they are NOT made for working out. While running and working out i've found that i have to pull them up often because they sag.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These are some of my favorite Lulu tights. I have two different colors and love them both. They are very versatile and the pockets keep everything in place, even on long distance runs. I love being able to put my phone in the pocket and get my workouts done. If you are considering these pants I would recommend taking the plunge and getting them.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: FAVORITE leggings ever but they're falling apart
column6: I've had these leggings for about 3 weeks and have worn them probably more than I should in 3 weeks because I love them so much but they are started to fray and become loose at the seams. These are more expensive than most Lulu leggings so I figured they would be better quality but only three weeks later, it looks like they've been worn for years.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Maclaine123,\nWe hear your disappointment and would like to chat about a solution. Give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 so they can continue this conversation and help.\nChat with you soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 5, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: When I tried these on in the store I was hooked. They look amazing on and seemed to hit every part of my lower body perfect. The day after i got them I went for a run and spent most of my run pulling them up. They kept falling down and sliding off. I can't spend the time i have to run worrying about my leggings coming down. For $128 I expect these to be perfect. When i got done with my run I noticed that the stitching was already coming out of them. I haven't even had these for 24 hours and already they are falling apart? not ok. I am a lulu lover but unfortunately these just really failed me.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Addijo,\nWe hear you. Slipping gear when you're trying to concentrate on pounding the pavement is not ideal. An email is headed your way so we can follow up and help.\nChat with you soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 5, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: This is my second pair of the All The Right Places Pant. The first pair I LOVED but had to return when the seems were running and coming loose. I loved the fit so much I bought a pair of the All The Right Places Pant II to give them a second chance and I am so so disappointed! I am running into the same problem and it seems they stretch out easily or they just don't stay up. Super disappointed because I love the material.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi there K111,\nI'm sorry to hear of your experience with the stretching of your pants, especially when this is your second go with them. I'd love to speak further with you, as I can understand why you're disappointed. Look for an email that will allow us to chat more and find a resolution.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 1, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: What is happening with these pants?
column6: The first pair I purchased I was IN LOVE with until I saw the seams unravelling after 1 wash on delicate with only other LLL items and nothing with hooks or zippers.. and lay flat to dry!! well... I purchased a second pair in the same size but they are almost completely see through.. I can see the beauty mark on my thigh THROUGH my leggings as I tried to put them on.. very strange. the first time I wore them they were ok.. I don't know what happens when these pants get wet.. Almost all of my tights are luxtreme i don't understand why these are giving me such a hard time.. I suggest trying them on in person
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey tfia,\nThanks for reaching out and sharing your feedback with us. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to ensure it performs well for you. It doesn't sound like this is the case and we'd love to help make things right. Please keep your eyes out for an email from us so we can follow-up.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 1, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I bought these leggings for my wife. They looked AMAZING on. Sitting down in the car on the way to the gym just a few minutes into the first wear we see a tiny hole just below the seem on the left upper thigh. My wife said she could mend them, but for $128, fresh out of the bag, there is no way we want to keep these poor quality pants.
What has happened to Lululemon quality? I will not encourage my wife to purchase $100+ leggings when we can find cheaper Made in the USA or Made in Canada options.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Bwana,\nThanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and want to make sure it's performing for you. I understand that this isn't the case for your wife, and would like to work with you to find a resolution. I’ve sent you an email to follow up. Chat with you soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 1, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Size down if you really want them
column6: Im a solid 8 in lulu bottoms and this pair I wish I had either gone a size down or not gotten at all. They keep falling down with every move. I do High intensity circuits and combat sports, these pants were useless for both I couldn't keep them up, but I luckily brought another pair of pants to train in.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
Come winter it was time to get some full length LLMs for my hiking, biking, and more!
These seem to do a bunch of stuff super right! Form fitting! Huggy! No muffin top!
But then also miss on a bunch of stuff.
I opted to get the 8s which were still pretty huggy and tight, but didn't have the kind of obvi camel toe that the 6's gave me, that otherwise also felt like a great fit... and I kind of regret that. After summitting Vermont, I found my pants needed hiking up on the reg, which is not something I want to be doing. I adore a lot of LLM's "I'm not wearing clothes" feel, and having to regularly adjust, pull up, etc... just doesn't quite do that for me.
They do in a pinch, especially as an under-layer.. but they're not acting as good stand-alone which is sad.
I'm torn on getting the 6s cause I do love so much about the design, but I'm worried they'll have the same prob.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I received my order and I was so excited... They fit well... fitted yet breathable.. 1 major problem they smell like GLUE! They smell like the packaging... I've washed them twice... Customer Service via chat recommended baking soda and water.. I've tried EVERYTHING... They only sell these online so I cant go to the store and exchange them so now I don't know what to do.. I cant wear them smelling like this... Had plans to wear them this weekend but I guess that's out of the question... So I guess I have to return them and hope I find something else I like or that I get a full refund to my account... So upset.. I wonder if I just got a bad pair.. Has anyone else had an issue with the smell of these pants when they got them or could it be, as I've mentioned, that I received a bad one! Should I try for another pair or just give up?

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: great leggings but fits larger than usual
column6: So i purchased these and the inspire tight II together both in size 4. and unfortunately they just don't fit as tight as it should. it is a bit loose at the knees and they are extremely long. BUT most importantly the quality of these just don't compare to the inspire as well. since i received both of them together and i wore the other pair more because it is still rather warm, i wanted some cropped ish leggings. And these were for winter but was too excited to try them out. after about 2 wears (not joking) the seams on the right side of the cheek line is unravelling, but everywhere else on the leggings is fine. I have no idea what happened. for 128 USD i expected better quality. Im also overseas, so i can't even take it to the store to return so sad.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hello there kahluamilk,\nThanks for reaching out with your feedback. I'm sorry to hear of the experience you've had with the unravelled seams on your pants. I'd love to help resolve this, so look for an email headed your way. We'll be able to chat further and fix this.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 29, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These were my favorite pants for a while....love the look and feel while wearing. The pockets are great too....also can wear as golf pants! Here's the negative....even though they are high waisted they seem to always be falling down. I'm constantly pulling them up (maybe the waistband elastic doesn't last?) and I've even had friends ask if my pants were falling down. If they stayed up they really would be the perfect pant...still searching!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Very comfortable and flaterring. Just wish they were shorter.
column6: I purchased these thinking they'd be a great length but they ended up being longer than my feet when on. So went to my local lulu store in Tampa (international mall) to get them hemmed and it ended up being a fiasco. Not sure if these are hard to hem or my stores seamstress is terrible... first job one leg was longer than the other, and second job it was finally right however all 20 pins were still left in the pants and I had to unclip all of them. But performance wise I have loved them and enjoyed the side pockets. My phone still gets wet when in the pocket though and that's really the only thing I don't like.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: All Your Wildest (Stretchy Pant) Dreams Will Come True
column6: I've been lusting after these pants for months, and finally pulled the trigger, despite some of the less-than-stellar reviews. AND ALL OF MY STRETCHY PANT DREAMS HAVE COME TRUE. I put on my All The Right Places Pants this morning at 7am - made a protein shake and went to Pure Barre at 8 where my instructor called me a "hot mama." So far so good. I then rode my bike to the coffee shop and grabbed a latte. The barista told me she loved my pants. THEN I cruised to a hot yoga class at 10, where I was approached by two women I did not know in the locker room who wanted to know where they could get my pants. After class, when I was uber sweaty, my friend who'd come to yoga with me ALSO asked about my incredible pants. I downed a coconut water and we headed to meet a crew of girls for brunch, and my pants that were pretty much dry by the time I got there. And everyone told me my a** looked amazing. So A) amazing pants day for me! These hold you in and look fantastic and the luxtreme dries super fast and B) I can imagine that if you are graced with slim hips and thigh gap these might slide down a bit. But for you ladies with athletic glutes and quads, these pants will certainly benefit the rear view. If you know what I'm sayin ;-)

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: love the pockets, hate unraveling seams!
column6: Love the fit, material and perfect cellphone pockets... but the seams are unraveling!! Completely unacceptable on pants that cost $129 and that have only ever been hand washed a handful of times due to this luxury pricing. Really wanted to love these and buy the calories, buy another pair, recommend to friends but not when the main feature (pockets) are unraveling :-(
column19:
{'LL_response_content': "Hey Mnwolf,
We hear your disappointment with the unraveling seams you're experiencing with your All The Right Places Pant II *Online Only.
An email is headed your way so we can follow up and work towards a solution together.
Speak with you soon.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 24, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Love these pants, but not in this color-SHEER Coverage
column6: I have these pants in black and love them. Before trying these pants on I inspected them and noticed that one seam on the leg had started to unravel. I mention this because I've bought clearance items before and did not notice until I got home that there was an issue with a seam. The SA assured me that if it got worse that I could exchange it with my previous item. Therefore, I know with these pants that if the cuff completely fell down that I could bring it back to the store for an exchange/hemming. However, these pants are SOOOOOO see through in this color. Now I'm stuck with a pair of pants that I'm afraid to even give away!!! Really wish clearance item weren't final sale.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Swim2016,\nWe're sorry to hear you're experiencing coverage issues with your All The Right Places Pant II. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. Please give our GEC a call- 1.877.263.9300 as they'll be able make some recommendations about how to proceed.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 21, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love the look of these pants. I actually have two pair that I initially purchased just because of the fit. I love the high waist and the big pockets especially. The only problem is that they slither down my body and I have to constantly pull them up (hopefully when no one is looking). I wonder if a smaller size would stay put better, but reluctant to try it.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi there jeanieree,\nThanks so much for reaching out with your thoughts. I'm sorry to hear of the experience you're having with the retention of your pants. I'd love to speak further with you about this, so look for an email that'll allow us to continue our conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 20, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I'm extremely upset with my purchase of these pants. While initially they look great on and feel great there are a number of issues. First, and least importantly, the stitching makes them uncomfortable to wear for longer than a few hours. Second, I've worn them 6 times (SIX. I know because they are so expensive I've kept count to ensure that I've been making the best use of them) and they are already falling apart! The stitching is falling out and becoming ratty. They are getting sheerer and sheerer with every wear. I only wash them gently and I have NEVER dried them in a dryer, not once, in an attempt to preserve the integrity. I really, really do not recommend these. I scrimped and saved just to buy one pair of lululemon pants, and I end up with an investment that is already falling apart. So disappointing.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ABAB,\nWe appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts on your All The Right Places Pant II. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way so we can follow up and work towards a solution together.\nChat with you soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 20, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The first time I put these on in the store, I just loved them. I have had them less than a week and I'm feeling a bit differently. I'm 5'11 and 139 pounds, so I decided to get a bigger size than I usually wear. I ended up leaning towards a 6 and I can not tell if I got too small of a size or its the pant. They are becoming a thinner and thinner material every time I wear them. I fear that they will become see through soon.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey ElizabethCK0001,\nWe appreciate you getting in touch. If you wish to continue this conversation, feel free to reach out to our GEC at 1.877.263.9300.\nChat with you soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 20, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I have had these pants about 6 weeks. I have worn them several times out and about (not even exercised in them) and have washed them once. I really love the way these pants fit and have had several compliments in the short time I've had them. However, yesterday I noticed a piece of cotton about the length of my arm hanging down. I couldn't believe it to find my $128 pants already coming undone all around the seam! The quality of this product is not up to standard and should not be falling apart after 6 weeks and 1 wash!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hello there Athletictrainer1,\nI'm sorry to hear of the undone seam that you're experiencing on your pants. I'd highly recommend reaching out to our GEC to chat about how to resolve this - 1.877.263.9300.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 18, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I've been a big fan of Lulu for years, and thought I was so in love with these pants for the way they fit--they're perfectly compressive for weightlifting and just being out and about. But the stitching on the side seams has been coming out, even though I've only had these pants for a month and wore them for two workouts. For pants well over $120, there shouldn't be such a quality issue!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi PowerliftingPhD,\nThanks for taking the time to connect with us. We're so sorry to hear of the unravelling stitching you're experiencing with your pants, and I totally get your concern. We stand behind our gear, so please give us a ring at 1.877.263.9300 so we can make things right.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 10, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I am 5'6" around 135lbs athletic body type, and I own size 6 in almost everything I have from Lulu. I got these in a size 6, and they felt great when I pulled them on initially. I love the way the feel on, and the big side pockets are awesome as well as the high waist. But I tried to run in them and they are impossibly saggy, to the point that I just had to stop and go home. They seriously felt like they would fall down and end up around my ankles. I'm going to try them in a size down, but I'm skeptical. It would help if they at least had a drawstring in the waist.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi there slcskimomma,\nI'm sorry to hear of the experience you've had with the retention of your pants. This shouldn't be happening, so I'd love to help you out. Watch for an email that details how to reach a resolution.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 8, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Sad to say, these fall down
column6:
I bought these in store at the same time as the Speed Tight V. I thought I would like these more by first impression. But first time out on my half hour bicycle commute they were falling down. At lights I had to stop and pull them up into my crotch, like pantyhose. Never happened to me with a Lulu bottom and I have a stable of them. I wound up getting 2 more of the Speed Tight btw. No regrets on that one.
I was able to exchange these for one of the 2 speed tights I further picked up. I am a size 2 (118 and 5'7"). I wonder if the problem is tied to continuous crotch and lack of front seam? which does have the effect (intent?) of pulling away which creates more problems maybe then it solves, at least with this bottom. I never btw heard of camel toe until I started buying these clothes and for me it is a non-issue. I sure am not monitoring anyone's crotch and I hope no one else is either; and maybe for some this is a comfort issue. Anyway, I'm not self conscious about the issue at all. We are females in form fitting clothes unless of course you don't want to be..

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Should be my favorite pants ever
column6:
I bought these in store and was SO excited to wear them. I bought my usual 12. I wear a 12 in pants at most stores. The fit seemed spot on, they were so comfortable and flattering.
I put them on to take a walk (nothing high intensity) and within 5 minutes I had to turn around and go back home because they were falling down. To the point that the crotch was halfway down my thighs. I don't think I will be able to use them for anything beyond lounging on the couch.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Not quite what I was hoping for
column6: The pockets are why I bought these pants, but they don't fit my phone and when I bend over to pick up weights it falls out, they are not tight enough to keep it in

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I am very conflicted about these pants. I received the exact ones on sale as a gift from my husband (pink, full length). I have actually been wanting the All the Right Places pants for a while, so I was stoked that he got them on discount. Ultimately, I love the fit. That's why I fell in love in the first place. The waistband is high but sits comfortably, the side pockets are a dream, and I can even get on board with the bright pink color. It's fun.
However, there are 2 things that would cause me to tell a friend to "think twice" before buying these. One, I have washed these once (as directed by the instructions also), and some of the seams are already fraying. I have 3 pants from lulu, and another pair did this as well. I thought it was a fluke, but it's happening again. Secondly, these tend to lean on the see through side.... Basically, I will not be wearing these on any sort of leg day, or a day where squats/lunges/deadlifts, etc are involved. It's not terrible, but any sort of underwear (or lack thereof...) is noticeable in the crotch area of the pants. The back is fine until you bend down (hence, not using them on leg day). The knee is a bit see through but who really cares about the knee I guess.
I like these pants a lot, but I wouldn't purchase again. It just seems like too much money to invest in a pair of pants that frays after 1 wash and are see-through. I'd expect this from a $20 pair of workout pants, but not these. Ultimately, disappointed in the quality, which is not reflected in the price.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey carathomp,\nIt sounds like these bad boys are giving you troubles in all the wrong places. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way with some solutions.\nChat with you soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 4, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These pants are perfection when you first try them on. I received them as a Mother's Day gift, and I've only worn them twice since that time because they fall down constantly. I thought they fit well when I first put them on, and I loved the high rise and thigh pockets for my phone. However, I've taken them on a 5 and 10 mile run (my 2x wearing them), and the crotch literally fell halfway down my thighs! Not cool to have to hold up your pants while running. The good news is that after a mile or two, I got sweaty enough that they stayed put, but that first couple miles are torture. Bummed these are so expensive and I can't wear them for anything besides lounge pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey bballrunner,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and would like to do some digging into the falling down you're experiencing. Reach out to the GEC at 1.877.263.9300 so one of our educators can continue this conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 4, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: The All The Right Places Pants have always been my favorite until my last purchase. I recently purchased the new teal colored pants and after one wear, the waist band seams are already coming undone. I have always loved these pants and was excited for this new color, but I am extremely disappointed as I paid $128 and only got one wear out of them before the seams began to unravel.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi there Kellirae,\nI'm sorry to hear of the experience you've had with the undone seams on the waistband of your pants. I totally can understand your disappointment and I'd like to make this right. Look for an email that will discuss the next steps to take.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 31, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I have this pants in black, blue and red and I absolutely love every single one of them. They stay in place, fitting like a glove. The size is true and the fabric is thick enough to keep me confident when I move in all directions on my mat. The only think is that they are a little pricey for a yoga pants, but at the end it is worthy!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
I loved the fit of these in store, and actually ended up buying the pant and the crop. This review is for the pants, as the crops have their own set of comments. The fit is fantastic, and for those of us who prefer higher cut waists these are PERFECT. They seriously hit at exactly the right spot so you feel comfortable and covered without being frumpy or rolling down when you bend over. I love the reflective band at the ankles, and thank you for the side pockets!
Unfortunately, they aren't totally opaque. Even in black, you can see skin and panties at the knee and the butt. Incidentally, this was only true in the pants and not in the crops. It isn't too terrible, but it was enough that my gym buddy pointed it out. I probably won't be wearing them to crossfit again. I wish I could count on the consistency of your quality, lulu!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey there lissabug,\nThank you for taking the time to reach out with your feedback. I'm sorry to hear of your experience with the coverage of your pants. I'd like to help work with you to find a resolution. Please look to your inbox for an email that will continues our conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 27, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These pants fit really well and I love the high waistline. However, for 128$, I would expect my seams to not pill. I just bought these during Christmas time and have taken great care of this product. The pilling has become a huge issue for me in many lulu products. I would not spend 128$ on these again.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey there recreationalrunner4,\nI'm sorry to hear of your experience with the pilling on the seams of your pants. I'd like to help you out, as we fully stand behind the quality of our gear. Watch for an email that will describe the next steps.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 27, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I love the fit of these pants. However, I will have to echo the sentiments of several previous reviewers. After only a few uses, the thread on the seams has loosened significantly and frayed in parts. I am very careful with my lululemon clothing -because they are expensive and I want them to last. I wash them in specially bags I purchased for this purpose. I'm pretty disappointed with the thread and stitching - as much as I love the fit, I'm not happy with the product I received for the price I paid.
column9: SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, CA, USA
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey mplstraveller,\nI'm sorry to hear of your experience with the fraying seams on your pants. I'd like to take the opportunity to turn this around for you. Watch out for an email that will describe how to move forwards.", 'LL_response_date': 'May 20, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I've worn Speed Tights and High Times consistently, and this combines the best aspects of both. They are really flattering and the paneling made me less self-conscious about my cellulite dimples on my legs--these babies are like a fabric lipo. I've worn and washed 3 pairs about 15 times and I've had no issues with loose threads. I am careful when I put them on and don't yank them up due to the seams, but it's a small compromise for great lifting pants.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Look Good, Feel Good, Quality is Not Good
column6: Bought these in a store, loved the compressed feel and thought they looked great on in the pretty blue color. Wore them once at the gym to run on the treadmill then to a yoga class. I did have sweat marks on the front body after the 5k, and looked a bit like I wet myself, so got some rather embarrassing stares waiting for the class... then vowed to only wear these to low-lit yoga classes. After hand washing and hanging dry, once, went to wear them a second time and saw the threads pulling off the left seam!! Took them off and haven't worn them since in fear of them coming completely unraveled. Sitting in my drawer is not worth $128!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey CenCalkrys,\nWe're sorry to hear your All The Right Places Pant II have unraveling seams. Our GEC have you covered and can work towards a solution with you. They can be reached at 1.877.263.9300.", 'LL_response_date': 'June 17, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
First things first, being the active crossfitter & yogi that I am, I've become a loyal Lulu customer. These pants were recommended to me in the store and after trying them on, I was immediately sold. The sales rep said that they're perfect for Crossfit activities and I'd have to agree, just based on the way they fit. They're tighter in areas that need extra compression, which I love, and the high rise waist gives you perfect lines. These pants, without a doubt, make your body feel and look ROCKIN. No joke, they're everything you've ever wanted and more in a pair of Lulus.
Why are they a tease?
Because the thread quality of these pants is terrible. I cannot express how disappointed I am with whoever chose the thread for these pants. And I'm also really disappointed in this person's coworkers for not stopping this embarrassing train wreck. I wore my first pair to one Crossfit workout, and I'll add that it was considerably moderate...I wasn't doing rope climbs or flipping tires. After the workout, the entire back seam had unraveled a single thread all the way up. Disappointed, but understanding that every once in awhile there's going to be a bad apple. I took them back to the store, where they swapped out another pair no problem. I cut the tags off this morning, wore them to the store, and noticed that the mediocre threading has failed yet again. This time, on the hip. I've called the store and requested that they hold another pair for me seeing that I'll be coming to make another swap.
What started as a GEM, has proven to be a complete tease and a slap in the face for those of us who purchase Lulu clothing on a monthly basis.
Stop sewing cotton (or anything related to cotton) thread on Lycra fabric Lulu, it's a shady way of cutting corners and if it weren't for your stellar customer service team, you guys would literally be in trouble. Obviously this is a reoccurring problem, figure it out guys.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey there BeLuluLoyal,\nThank you for taking the time to let us know of your experience. I'm sorry to hear that this has happened twice, but I'm glad that the store has been able to help you out. It's definitely valuable feedback that we'll be passing forward. If there are any complications at the store, please feel free to reach out to our GEC - 1.877.263.9300.", 'LL_response_date': 'April 19, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
Overall: I love just about everything about these; they are quickly becoming a staple in my workout gear wardrobe.
Quality: Mine (unlike some others, yikes!) seemed to have come from a good batch; seams are good and sturdy...so far, totally opaque - I'm in love with luxtreme!
Fit: I have the prior All the Right Places in Black and Bordeaux Drama and these version, II, in Black and both fit amazingly well; I found them to be true to size for a nice, snug fit.
Style: Panels, panels, panels! The panel detailing is to die for; the lines of these beautifully accentuate the lines of the body.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I loved the idea of these pants and loved the look of all the seams. However, I wasn't impressed with the fit. I am 5'3" 100lbs and a true size 4 in ALL lulu bottoms. I have thinner legs and have never had a problem with any lulu leggings being loose but these were a tad too wide on my legs and looked bulky, especially at the knees. I tried to size down to a 2 but the waist was a bit too tight (although legs fit nice). If they had fit better, I would definitely have kept them! Something to consider for my thin-legged sisters out there!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I personally love these leggings! I only wore them once for working out but they are worn multiple times a week to school. I got them as a gift and intended to buy MANY more pairs in a size 4 so please bring more back in stock! The only problem I have is the seams tearing. I noticed one in between my legs and not even a week later there was one on my butt. I do not know what to do especially since there is no more in my size.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi lulufanatic99,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out and share your experience with the All The Right Places Pant II. We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 28, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I was really excited to wear these lulu pants, as they were my first purchase and first lulu pants worn. I've always heard how amazing they were and was excited to wear them to work, but when I got home I noticed that there was a hole forming in the crotch! Some of the stitching starting coming undone and even more had started unraveling on the upper thigh. I'm so disappointed because they fit really well. But to only have worn them to work for one day without even working out in them and to see that happening I'm really disappointed with the amount of money I spent on them. I tried uploading a picture of the hole but the image uploaded keeps saying there's an error processing etc.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Louise9,\nThanks for taking the time to share with us about your All The Right Places Pant II. I’m sorry to hear of the unravelling seams and hole you’re experiencing with them. We stand behind our quality, and we’d love to work with you towards a solve. I’ve sent you an email to follow up and help. \nChat with you shortly. ', 'LL_response_date': 'March 27, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I got these pants in the mail this morning and loved them, they were perfect and flattering in every way. I am always a size 8 in all Lululemon, so I went with my regular size. I wore these today while I went to the movies, no gym or anything like that. When I got home I noticed a spot in the back of the pants, at first I thought it was just fuzz or something but it ended up being a hole. No physical activity or anything of the sort, not washed, worn less than 5 hours and there is a hole in the back. For 130 dollar pants I am so disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi kaylaniicolle,\nWe're sorry to hear a hole developed on your All The Right Places Pant II. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 22, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column5: Might just call these the best pants ever
column6:
I tried these on as a recommendation from one of Lulu's floor workers. I was hesitant because the material was not like my other favorite pair of pants the wunder under. She only had the navy blue color, but I hesitantly took the pants and into the dressing room I went.
WOW. I think I'm in love with a pair of pants. These pants do serious wonders for your thighs and butt. They definitely hold everything in and are just high enough waisted.
I am 5'9", 148lbs, and got the size 6. I also ordered these in black... so soon I will have two pairs! Oops!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These and the crops are the absolute most flattering and best performing pants I have purchased and I have over 10 pairs of lulu pants :') this style doesn't have a horrendous seam on the crotch which is extremely important to me! PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE RESTOCK THIS STYLE WITH MORE COLORS AND WHAT NOT :((( <3

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
These pants are amazing. I have a pair of the All the Right Places Pant from several months ago (still in great shape btw). These are, I think, identical except for the flip-up reflective strip on the ankles, which is a great addition.
The Hero Blue color is so gorgeous, rich and opaque. They're a nice change from my usual black. They do show sweat a bit, but that happens to all of my pants, so it's not a defect IMO. Please keep Hero Blue around!
I'm 5'7" 160lb, 36-26-40, and my usual size 8 was perfect for these pants. The seaming is so attractive and creates beautiful lines down the legs. The waist is the perfect rise, and I love the smooth front.
I highly recommend these pants for a sweaty yoga practice. I practice Ashtanga, and I much prefer the Luxtreme of these and other pants to Luon for sweat-wicking purposes.

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought the first version of these pants in a size 4 - I'm 5'9 and 150lbs. I loved these pants for about month...until the seam in the crotch began to rip. I only wore them maybe once or twice a week because they were compression, so I expected them to last a good deal longer than they did. I swear by lulu pants and this is the first time anything like this has happened, but I am still very dissapointed and sad that I can no longer wear my almost brand new leggings. I would suggest buying a different but similar pair of lululemon leggings over these if you can help it to avoid this problem.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi circusmaniac,\nOh dear. Here at lululemon athletica, we stand behind the quality of our gear. I’m sorry to hear that your pants aren't holding up as expected, and encourage you to call our GEC so we can learn more about your experience: 1.877.263.9300.", 'LL_response_date': 'March 10, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: My all time favorite pants! I wear them constantly. Perfect for tennis as I can tuck the extra ball or two in my pockets. I wear them at least 2-3 times per week!!
column15: could you please add a few more colors?

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: These pants are great! I use these for both yoga and crossfit, and occasionally as part of my daily wardrobe! They fit close to true size - I am 5'9 and a normal size 4, but found the 6's to fit perfectly (I have long legs and larger quads/glutes). They definitely hold up to the squat test, and are thick enough to not show underwear. They are probably the most flattering pair of workout pants I have ever owned. The side pocket is great and will fit my huge phone securely! Also, the one piece front seaming really does prevent camel toe! The only problem is what a few others have mentioned about the stitching coming loose in a few places, but it's expected through normal use!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I bought the first version of this pant and one of the seams started to fray after my second use. I was thinking of returning or exchanging for a bigger size, because it could be fraying due to that, but the pant went out of stock and now there's a new pant, so I don't think they will let me exchange. The material seems kinda thin as well, and I'm always worried if I fall while I run, it'll tear. I Hope the new pant doesn't have these problems.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey again juliette1121,\nOh dear. We just sent you an email regarding a previous review and encourage you to include the information for this pant as well. We look forward to chatting further with you!', 'LL_response_date': 'February 29, 2016'}

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6: I just purchased these and wore them at boot camp and they were wonderful! I didn't have to keep pulling them up and they kept me feeling secure! I was a little nervous of wearing them in the sunlight but they fit great and my husband said they were not see through at all!

column1: All The Right Places Pant II 28"
column6:
These are by far my favorite Lulu pants! The material holds you in while the seaming creates a slimming effect, and no camel toe ever! They stay in place during intense workouts and the high-rise waist completely eliminates the constant tugging and pulling up (which is so annoying during a workout). I even got my mom and sister hooked!
The only negative is that the threads poke out at the seams almost immediately. I've had to snip the ends of the threads after only one wear. Also, the colors are kind of boring. I'd love to see black with mesh, or two-tone colors like black and grey or navy and grey.
